column5: Pat Roberts May 30 at 8:49pm ¬∑  Tyvm to @Tesco.com.   Sowton   Exeter. Within 30 mins of my complaint flowers   choccies & other goodies arrived on my doorstep. very good customer care!

Love doing an online order - expecting it between 9 + 10 this evening - gets to 10:45 nothing  no email no phone call nothing! so ring tesco to be told my cards been declined - ring the bank and it hasn t and no one at tescos knows nothing! Have to wait until the morning for any answers! Angry is an understatement üò°

I received a very disappointing e-mail from topcashback today (copied below). Could you please tell me why tescos has made this decision? I get very few points from tesco and this is the only way I manage to boost my points every year to take part in your online clubcard boosts. I am aware you are meant to be running some new points promotions in store  but have yet to see any sign of this and as I am a single person shopping for just me  think it s unlikely to get me any great amount of points  and certainly not the ¬£50 a year I have been getting through topcashback. Unfortunately my date for exchange is in December  so with you withdrawing at such short notice  I won t be able to use this method again üòî At this rate there seems very little point in giving tesco my business at all anymore as without the clubcard points there really is no benefit to shopping there when I have all the major 5 retailers locally and lidl  with Aldi also arriving in the next few mths.  We are getting in touch to let you know about changes to payout options available. Tesco has recently made some alterations to its Tesco Clubcard scheme and as a consequence from the 31st July 2016  Tesco Clubcard points will no longer be available as a payout method. While we realise this may be frustrating for members  TopCashback tried to do everything it possibly could to keep Tesco Clubcard as a payout method on site.   Our records show that you have either previously used Tesco Clubcard as a payout method or have registered your Tesco Clubcard to your account so if you would like to take advantage of the Tesco Clubcard payout method one last time you have until the 31st July to do so.   We have spoken with members who have previously used Tesco Clubcard as a payout method and a third told us they exchanged cashback for Tesco Clubcard points to then transfer them into airmiles points (i.e. Avios). Three in 10 swapped cashback into points for restaurants vouchers and a fifth paid for family days out.

Good evening Tesco  Could you tell me the best way to contact your stores regarding supporting a charity event for Macmillan Cancer Support? I visited a few stores over the weekend  but find that the staff are naturally busy and often the correct person isn t available to speak to. Maybe you could tell me if there a more convenient way I could get in touch with somebody? Thank you :)

I do understand that your 10pm delivery slots are convinient to some but I *wish* your drivers would show a teeny bit of consideration to families that may already be sleeping when they do their late deliveries ..shush please! üôä

A huge well done on loosing a valid customer today due to poor customer service. Head office will be getting a call tomorrow and the matter will not be dropped!!! To be accused of something over an obvious mistake is not something I will not take lightly....üëèüëè

I was bra shopping with my girlfriend tonight and the other occurred to me that surely the larger cup bras should be higher up in the display. Like eye level or slightly higher. It can t be comfortable for ladies with larger chests to be bending right over to look near the bottom.

Click and collect item not arrived again! Devastated as this was a present for my son for his birthday tomorrow. Spoken with the store and customer services who say  it should  be there tomorrow. Now 10 pm and too late to go elsewhere to get the present for the morning. With no compensation offered from Tesco. So dissapointed and will not use this service again.

Amazing customer service from the gentleman on the click and collect desk in your Newton Abbot store this afternoon. I didn t catch his name but he went above and beyond for me today and it was really appreciated.  He s a brilliant asset to your store! üëçüèª

Hi I would like to raise an issue  I regularly buy savaloys from the deli counter almost on a daily basis. That much in my local tescos the staff know me as savaloy man. Anyways I have notice a huge lack in quality of the product now. Not as big in size. Always dry and hard past few days I have bought them and my cats wouldn t even touch them  it s more annoying because Tesco is pretty much the only place in my area that sells them. I do say to the staff they quality has dropped but nothing has being done. Hope you can try and resolve the matter

I purchased a Tesco branded automatic air freshener in store a few weeks ago and I went out to Tesco to purchase a new re-fill  and it doesn t push down enough to spray anymore.... I do not have a receipt for the automatic but by any chance could I have this replaced? THANK YOU! :)
Hi I would like to ask as you are removing all Irish food from your British stores  will you be keeping the Polish section of food or will this stay . Thank you
I ve been told that you are no longer selling the free from onion rings? Please can you confirm if this is true and if it is  why? Thanks
Can you please tell me why the Northern Ireland deck chairs with the Ulster Flag crest on the arnt on sale in our Carrickfergus store ??
Some of my shopping missing again :\
So had problems with order email tesco and  get ignored
Well done Tesco s opticians in Kingston MK!  My son only had his eye test on Saturday and collected his new glasses today.  We are delighted with them!  Thanks!
cant amend shopping get -  400 Bad Request Request Header Or Cookie Too Large nginx  & Android App Not Working/Hanging too
Whats the best way to book Farm to Fork trails at local stores???

Hi I brought a trampoline last August from your store it s been stored away for the winter from late sept until April this year however at the weekend we have noticed the fibre glass top rim which holds the netting up is broken is this still under guarantee  Thanks

I used to be a regular customer but sadly Tesco lost me as a customer many months ago due to the freshness of products.I thought I would visit again and was impressed with the stir fry products. Bought the noodles  rice etc and was looking forward to a fresh stir fry until I opened the chicken fillets. The smell was dreadful even though package dated 4th June. Again Tesco has let me down. No supper and no more visits to Tescos.
How can I find out if my local store  Corstorphine in Edinburgh  is taking part in the 3 for 2 you offer on 2 and 3 June?

We have just had yet another easy food delivery from two very lovely delivery drivers. Every single time we have a home delivery the drivers are always happy  polite and very helpful. Thank you Tesco for making life that little bit easier!!

Very disappointed that after numerous phone calls to customer service and visits to the store I still cannot get an answer on how to get my huddle fixed ! I took it to the store in January and it was just month out of warranty and as I couldn t find my receipt   I had to call customer services which I did and gave details of my club card etc etc ...no response within the week that they promised ...I called again and still no reply so I go on holiday without a huddle for my daughter in 2 weeks!  Wasn t aware it was such an ordeal to get ur products repaired !! Poor service Tesco!

Tesco Hull St Stephens store -  Yorkshire  Ham on the Deli counter. Only to have a label underneath stating is produced in Ireland  using Pork from the E.U. I understand we are in the European Union  but you do expect this to be British meat at the very least. I am also fed up of seeing mostly Irish meat in our stores. Very misleading

I ve been buying your free from digestive biscuits for a while for my little girl who has multiple allergies. I came to buy them today and noticed they now contain soya. The change in packaging is quite subtle and there is no mention of a new recipe. Had I not noticed and given these to my daughter we could have ended up with a hospital stay. I can t understand the logic of introducing one of the top allergens into a free from product that has previously been fine without it but more importantly I feel this change should be made clearer as it could have a real effect on people s  health.  It s so hard to find biscuits my daughter can have and these were her favourites so I have a very upset little girl on my hands

To whom it may concern   I have just read an article regarding you removing Irish products from your shelves.  As an Irish person living in the UK I am let down you ve decided to remove it from your world foods section and I m sure plenty more will be.

Is there an age restriction for home delivery with basic food shopping? (No items a child couldn t have brought in store) I ve just been woken up after a 10h night shift and didn t get to bed till midday because my 23yr old daughter doesn t have ID? Yours sincerely Bloody Knackered!

HI  I was wondering if Tesco would be willing to offer a donation for a fundraising day i am doing on behalf of Help 4 Heroes ? Anything gratefully received. I have a letter of authourisation if you need to see it :)

Hi I complained a while back regarding smoking in the trolley parks at my local Cleckheaton tesco. After my complaint the smoking stopped however the past 4 times I ve been staff have been smoking in and around the trolley shelters.  A netto has opened down the road. I think I ll be taking my custom there instead of taking my children to breathe in second hand smoke.

Hello!   I m just writing this to ask you to acknowledge the kindness and support The manager and staff of your cafe in the Bicester store showed today whilst my son  who has suspected autism (yet to be diagnosed)  had a meltdown. I believe the managers name is Robbie.  Most times when this happens all we get is stares and judgements from passers by. Robbie provided us with somewhere quiet to take my son to so he could calm down when I was struggling to do so in such a busy place.   So thank you very much Bicester cafe staff for helping and most importantly not judging my son. I can t tell you how amazing this is and I appreciate your kindness so very much!

We always have our shopping delivered from Tesco  and while the people who make the deliveries are usually cheerful enough  last week our delivery was made by the most helpful  and lovely lady ever!   We were her penultimate delivery of the day  and it was late in the evening. She still had a smile on her face despite the long shift  and not being able to park close to our house. She noticed the stair gates and baby monitor and proceeded to help me with the shopping into the kitchen  incredibly quietly so as not to wake my daughter.  I m afraid I didn t catch her name  but I didn t want this level of customer service to go unnoticed. We are in Coventry.   We were so impressed! Well done  Tesco!

Just want to say a massive thank you to Michelle who works at your Warndon Worcester branch who has just helped me and my 10 month old son. I was about to load my shopping onto the checkout this afternoon when my son began to cry hysterically . Michelle quickly came over and kindly offered to unload my shopping from my trolley onto the conveyor. She then continued to pack my shopping into bags and accompany me to my car all so I could see to my baby. She was fantastic and really helped me out. Superb customer service and a credit to your team. I really hope she gets the recognition she deserves from this post. Thanks again Michelle üòÄ
Thank you Tesco Chineham Centre Basingstoke for their kind donation of raffles prizes in support of Muffin s Dream Foundation  Basingstoke. Every little helps :-)

Hello Tesco  can you tell me why your La Hacienda BBQ/Pizza Oven was ¬£100 at your Stevenage  Roebuck store but ¬£150 at your Stevenage  town centre store? Quite shocked to see a fifty pound difference from one end of the town to the other and certainly kicking myself for not buying it at ¬£100... Needless to say they were sold out when I returned to buy one at the cheaper price...

Dear Sir/Madam  I am writing to complain regarding my recent online order. Myself and my partner do not have a large budget for food shopping and so choose to shop with Tesco as you have the best value for money. According to your website  you also ensure that your packers provide the longest life available on foods.  The order we placed was delivered at 10pm on Thursday 26th May. 2 items had expired by Saturday  5 by Sunday  10 by Monday and 11 by today. The total for this food works out to be ¬£29.14. It doesn t sound like a lot but we have now had to go elsewhere to replace this wasted food (who on earth could eat 1kg of mince  950g of chicken and 16 sausages in 3 days?). These totals only relate to the expiry dates provided on your products  but many of these had already gone off prior to this date.  We do not drive  so cannot return this food to your store for a refund. As such  what would you suggest we do? We are completely unsatisfied with the quality and life of the food we have received and expect to hear from you soon.  Regards Rebecca Davis

Redmere Farms Sweetheart cabbage  bought this morning in Tesco Kettering...Sell by date June 3rd  grown in Spain. I have just cut into it for tonights dinner and unable to use it  so I am a veg short...It has brown mould marks all the way through...I really don t rate this brand at all !!!    Please don t tell me to take it back...its pouring with rain here !!...I won t be buying Redmere Farms produce again...I would like to buy British but it is nearly impossible in Tesco.
Just wanted to say thanks for the food poisoning via the Samosa s I bought from Walkden store a couple of hours ago.
I ve just driven for for three miles through Chesterfield and haven t seen a Tesco  have you gone out of business? Or is our small town not good enough anymore?
Trying to apply for a job via your careers site is impossible ive applied 20+ times and still incuscessful seriously

Sat in waiting for shopping to be delivered between 11 and 12 no sign call up customer services they can t get hold of store or driver in assured I ll get a call back within 15 mins! 40 mins later no call so I call them back to be told they haven t got my correct number even though I put in my home and mobile when ordering. I explain I m waiting to go out as I have work this afternoon 3 kids on half term waiting to have their lunch no food in the house as I m waiting for my shopping!! To be told it will be delivered between 4 and 6 no offer of refunding my shopping for wasting my time no offer to try get here sooner!!    Great customer service tesco!! Won t be using you services again üò°
The other week I took a product back for a refund. After looking at my bank statement today I can see you have only refunded half the amount!
Hello tesco . My club card points are STILL not going into my account for my online shops .....

Been on hold now for 20 minutes trying to get through to your customer services.  Ironically to set up my online account to shop with you as I m  having  issues online........maybe I should use this experience of an indicator of what to expect from tesco customer service and online experience.........still on hold....

HI  we ordered a Sony 40  TV via Click and Collect in Hampton Peterborough store  we picked it up at Lowestoft and set it up on Sunday  unfortunately we can hardly see the picture during the day  it is a bit better at night but not perfect  so we need to return it. We no longer have the box it came in because we wanted it for our caravan and once we took it out of the box we disposed of the box ( no space to keep it) What do you suggest we do?
Barnstaple  Devon. Store has a small Polish section  but no Kefir in the refridgerated section. I know it is stocked in many of your stores  can we have this in Barnstaple please.

I m an Italian girl and I want to make a complaint. Yesterday (30 May 2016 around 6pm) I went to one of your stores  the Tesco in Paul Street Shopping Centre-Lavits Quay (Cork)  where I had problems with my identity documents because the cashier and the manager of the store didn t recognise my Italian ID card and instead insisted on seeing my passport. I m a European citizen and my documents are valid in the whole of Europe and I have never had problem. Also  it is unacceptable that the company policy sometimes accepts documents such as my driving licence and sometimes not. So  I think I will change the supermarket I go to from now on.

Good morning. I was looking at using some of my Clubcard vouchers for days out during this half term. Is there not an option to print the vouchers yourself at home or is it only via post you can receive them. Many thanks.
Once again your customer service team do a 5 star job! Now to get your drivers to be a little more happy haha!
There is a message on Facebook saying that Tesco are removing the word  Easter  from its chocolate eggs this year. Is this true?
Hi is the club card boost still on in store?

Can you confirm that the following  seen recently on Facebook  apparently issued by Tesco is true  please?   As of Easter 2017  Tesco will no longer sell any Easter eggs that use the word  Easter  on the packaging.  It has come to our attention that this is found to be offensive by members of certain faiths.  Rather than antagonise any religious group  we will refrain from selling them products.   This is a Christian country.  If the above is true  has Tesco not considered that millions of people in this  our country  will be highly offended?  What will be next?  Tesco refusing to sell any products that use the word  Christmas  on the packaging?
So annoying when you place an order and before the product is even delivered it is reduced and has nearly ¬£100 off üò†üò†

Really disgusted in tescos I ordered a big bulk lot online using my clubcard vouchers which then came in 2 lots and missing one of my items (iron) for tescos to tell me instore that a refund will be given. Go online to find no clubcard points has been refunded so I ring your customer service line last week gave details of my order to be told he would send a voucher for the cost of the iron  (¬£18) though a email. I ve waited a week and still nothing  I rang back up 2 days ago for the lady to say she would sort the problem out and resend it.... and guess what still nothing? !  I know my emails are fine as I m still receiving emails from yourselfs from the baby group I m in.  I think waiting over 2 weeks is disgusting and feel like I m getting fobbed off.  Wasn t my fault tescos mucked up my order and sent half to a different store.

Having contacted your website and received an unsatisfactory reply I thought I would try here..... The charger for my hudl2 no longer works and I am trying to get a replacement .... As the hudl is a Tesco exclusive product I had expected to be able to easily obtain a new charger from you?  Please can you advise me how I can purchase a replacement so that I can continue to use my hudl?
Gallows Corner Extra is meant to be open from 00:00 today  & yet here I am sat in the carpark looking at closed shutters. What gives?
Genius move by getting Alan Partridge to film in one of your stores . Love AP well done Tesco

Tesco  you need to invest in methane clathrates  ie ice blocks coming up from under the ocean containing 1 part pure ice water and 250 parts methane.   The way to do this is catch them like fish then impound them in cold high pressure containers  separate the water from the methane  sell the methane for slow burning and give the water to whoever needs it but only  Only  for growing plants such as in Africa  not for human but all life benefit.   I am being shut out of other sites.

I m a Status Quo fan and have heard their greatest hits album  12 Gold Bars  has been re-released on gold vinyl only in Tesco with ¬£2 going to the Nordoff Robbins Music Theropy charity and I would like to buy it but I would like to know if your Blackburn store has it in stock?

Can I please ask that you make your delivery drivers aware of the Cycling Scotland Give Everyone Cycle Space campaign. While out on a cycle tonight I was nearly hit by one of your delivery vans who passed me far too close. Nowhere near enough space. Thank you.
Totally disgusted tonight opened a cheesecake to find a chunk already taken out before we bought shocked totally shocked not too mention disgusted and disappointed!!
Just been to Tesco s in Bedfont. 18p a Banana? That is some profit margin. Question  why aren t they weighed  why individually priced?

Visited your branch in larkfield kent this afternoon to purchase some bunches of flowers and other items.  However on selecting the bunches I noticed there weren t any flower bags so I went to customer services for help.  At the desk I was met by 2 ladies who looked like they didn t really want to be there. No smile. No  can I help you?   I explained I wanted a bag for the flowers so they didn t drip on me whilst I picked up a few more things. I was told quite nonchalantly that they didn t have any bags. No sorry for no flower bags. They just looked at me like it was my fault.  I explained again. One of the ladies briefly looked up at me and suggested  a tissue?  Then the other lady had the bright idea to actually look for a bag at the desk. She found one. I walked away thinking for such a giant in our food industry your customer service skills are pretty small.   I then went to tk max in Maidstone where my faith in customer service was restored. They on 2 occasions have gone above and beyond to make me a  happy customer. I will of course be congratulating them.
Thanks to Tesco pharmacist @ Cirencester who sorted me out with a Ventolin inhaler when I got caught out without this afternoon - only need them when I have colds and has misjudged!

Hi  the nursery I work at is having a summer fair on the 16th July to raise funds for the charity  Winston s Wish. I was wondering if any of the Tesco stores did donations gor such events e.g. raffle prizes? I would ve able tp provide proof of the event and also credit would be given in our monthly news letter. Lindsay x

Could you please tell me when the Scottish stores will stock the status quo LP 12 gold bars that is now instore in the English stores  or how i can get a copy  as its for charity i feel this is important

Would just like to warn people of a very dangerous near miss we had today with a Tesco own kettle. Put it on to boil as usual and it suddenly burst into flames  very nearly burning my husbands hand in the process. We have had this less than six months. We also have small children in the house and the entire downstairs filled with acrid smoke. Phoned customer services who just said bring it back with receipt but didn t appear overly concerned at all. Husband still bit shaken!

Really dissapponted with your nappies (not the tesco value ones!). My son can t use pampers/huggies so I decided to try a packet of yours. EVERY nappy today has exploded and the insides come out. Bearing in mind they weren t on for longer than 2 hours at a time!

Dear Tesco We bought some of your bake at home flapjack cookie dough in our weekly shop and tonight we baked the cookies.  Eagerly awaiting the yumminess...   However... Whilst baking they didn t smell particularly good  but on removing from the oven they smelt like vomit.  We left them to cool  just in case  but when we tried them they actually tasted disgusting... As they smelt.. Like vomit...  Very disappointed with this product.  I have only used half of the dough  so will be returning the remainder and the 2 baked cookies to my local store tomorrow...  Not a happy customer this evening :-(
What s up with the pork lately? I ve had to throw the last 2 lots I ve brought away now cos despite being in date it stinks to high heaven! Very annoying

went to tesco in Bournemouth (riverside avenue  BH7 7DY) today  and on the way out tried to get petrol but there was very few pumps with unleaded  most of the 16 pumps were diesel only... lucky we werent desperate so went elsewhere  why no unleaded?? the garage was busy with cars changing pumps trying to find a pump with unleaded but not having much luck

Thank you so much to Tesco Extra in Kilmarnock for donating some great raffle prizes for our Sports Day. Senga called us to say that you would like to support our event and asked us to drop in to collect our goodies. So nice for local companies to support our school. Many thanks!

Why are potatoes that are branded as Maris Pipers in your Haddington store  not actually Maris Piper?  The bag I bought on Friday  turned to lumpy glue when mashed.  I will be taking this up with the store in question  but wanted to ask on here f anyone else has experienced this.

I am a regular customer of Tesco and haven t had a problem until recently. Today I had my online shop delivered with the majority of the fridge produce within a day or 2 of being out of date. The delivery man was very apologetic and asked if I wanted to check my order but with the amount delivered it wasn t possible until putting it away. This is the second time that I have had a weekend online shop with a lot of BB or use by dates of less than 3 days.
How do iI get some voucher s

Why is it that every time I try and order a small piece of ginger (guide price ¬£0.41) I end up receiving an actual full piece of ginger thus being charged much more due to incompetent staff. This has happened on numerous occasions which I have previously just let slide however yet again today I get home to find a humongous piece of ginger. It s pretty frustrating when I will have paid approx ¬£10 extra over my past few shops due to this happening. I thought click and collect was supposed to make life easier however the amount of times I have had to contact you regarding issues with my shopping.. I m beginning to think otherwise??

Dear Tesco  I ordered some balloons as part of my shopping to be delivered on Friday. The balloons were supposed to be used as part of a fundraising event yesterday evening for Greyhound Gap. The balloons arrived on time and I took them along to the event. Games time arrived and the balloons were blown up and attached to the attendees at the event. The idea was that they were popped by one person crushing them against another. Unfortunately the balloons are apparently made of Kevlar and they proved almost indestructible! While this is fantastic if you are using them to decorate a party or give to a child  it s terribly disappointing for a group of adults trying to raise money whilst amusing themselves in a childish way! Perhaps a value section of balloons is needed for just this type of thing? I can provide video evidence of the complete failure of the balloons to poo of you would find this useful?
CRAFTY  hayfever relief tablets 10 mg one month  30 tablets ....next month 14 tablets same price THATS MORE THAN DOUBLED THE PRICE....?*#*****???!! !

Absolutely fed up trying to get parked in your stores with my disabled child. 9 cars parked without displaying any disabled badge!! What is your stores stock answer to that problem?  We are not allowed to intervene / send a complaint to head office we can t do anything at store level  it s absolutely diabolical that in this day & age you are practically condoning these customers behaviour by ignoring the problem! You are the only major supermarket not to work towards preventing non disabled badge holders from parking in designated disabled bays! Why is that??
Went to Tesco today  ignored by staff while trying to find something. Gave up and went to waitrose. Nice one tesco!

Bought some tesco finest vintage cheddar and beef burgers the other day  very disappointed  they had so many large lumps of gristle in them I fail to see how they can be from selected cuts of prime beef! Won t be buying those again.

Bought some Tesco s finest Belgian Triple Chocolate Shortbread and was most disappointed. Have had these before and really love them but something was so wrong with these. No flavour - no sweetness - no sugar coating - hard and bitty. If the mix has been changed it is horrible. Won t get them again !!

Tesco please bring back the butternut squash noodles they were a heaven send! Gutted is an understatement that you ve stopped selling them :( the courgette noodles just don t have the same star factor.
Tesco once again you have let me down with a failed delivery on a bank holiday. Absoloutly appauling I will not be shopping with you again!!!

Can you please say thank you to the nice chap at Customer Services who phoned in response to my query about the Tesco Gold coffee?  I left comments saying Thank You for changing the lid  and asking if they had changed it recently because it didn t have the same  oomf  as it normally did.  He phoned me back  even before I d received the confirmatory e-mail  and said that he d looked into it  and the supplier had changed on 22 Mar and would pass my comments up the chain.  Then after I d had a whinge about the new veg range  he said he d send me a ¬£10 e-voucher to compensate as a  good will  gesture.  Which is nice.  Again  hank you very much.  And yes  I really do need to get out  more  but I ve got a broken hip and don t really have much else to do.  Would you like  me to be a  taster  for the company?  I d be very good at it.

A big thankyou to Tesco Hardwick today  and the Duty Manager  who donated some clothing and nappies to a mum and toddler who suffered a house fire last night  leaving them homeless and without basic supplies x

Have just had a terrible experience in your Tesco Express in Millbrae Road Glasgow. Was trying to make a purchase and as only one member of staff on the tills We tried to use the self service till. My husband scanned the purchase and the machine asked for and took our cash a ¬£10 note it kept asking for payment although the machine had swallowed the ¬£10. The man on the checkout eventually came and said the machine says you owe ¬£1.98 we said we had put in cash which the machine had taken and he said the machine says you owe ¬£1.98 his inference was that we were not telling the truth. By this time there was a large queue both at his till and behind us it was most embarassing. I asked why he was on his own and he rang for the manager. A tall man in a suit eventually came some minutes later. I asked why there were not more staff since it was busy and he replied it was empty a few minutes ago. He checked the machine and agreed we had deposited ¬£10 but he could not get the machine to issue our change either. Eventually I asked for our ¬£10 back so I could make my purchase elsewhere. At no time did we recieve an apoligy for our treatment and I again emphasise that we were left feeling we were in the wrong and that we had not paid for our purchase. The situation would not have arisen if Tesco did not rely on machines instead of actual staff. I fear I will not be visiting this store again  I await your reply with interest

Thank you Lucy from Tesco s Customer Self Help....having a lovely chat online after she offered to try and help with my problem regarding contacting my local store about my campaign.  You re a gem...and hope you manage to find homes for all of your kittens! :)

Went to get some free from digestive biscuits for my 18 month old who is dairy and soya intolerant and was very disappointed to see these now contain soya flour. Why have the ingredients suddenly been changed very disappointed and my toddler was pointing and shouting for her favourite biscuit and was very upset when we walked off without putting them in the trolley. Thanks Tesco perhaps consider people who have soya intolerance too

Would just like to say just how belittled I felt when I went to get fuel for my motorcycle at your filling station. Criminalised because I ride a motorcycle. Ridiculous. Even Asda don t ask me to remove my crash helmet or get off my bike. Won t be back and I ll let all my fellow bikers know to avoid Tesco petrol stations in future.

My son bought a 4 slice toaster for me as a gift earlier in the year well only 2 slices worked other tripped all my electrics ( couldnt return a gift so made do ) well now none of it works just trips my electric would i be able to return without receipt its only 5 months old üòû just want to replace it

Hi  can you please explain the change in policy regarding fueling motorcycles? No longer allowed to sit on the bike while filling up the tank and having to remove helmets when paying?  I and a few friends have now been refused pump authorisation until we get off the bikes and then spoken to like dirt regarding fueling and removing helmets from your employee taking payment.  I for one will be avoiding Tesco petrol stations and will be passing the message along to local bike groups and friends.

Hi can someone help me with a gift card issue please.I have a balance remaining on a gift card that I applied to my Tesco Direct account.I want to use the remaining balance towards my next order but I can t find it...:(     I no longer have the gift card.
Good to see one of your delivery drivers using his mobile phone whilst driving

Just collected my online shop from Dudley extra  can you explain what the need was to bag prepacked steak and mince beef? I d requested no bags  but these items were put in your  red  bags which are just a  complete waste to our environment?

Seriously need to work on yr substitution options for home delivery. Why on earth when you sone have the pantene shampoo didn t u out one of the dozen other shampoo varieties instead choose tresemee! ! Obviously had to reject it. Awful stuff. I can t thank staff from the Coatbridge Faraday store tonight enough. I came in with a basket to top up on barbeque food that i didn t order with my home delivery. On Saturday morning I bought a well needed bunk bed and a single mattress for my kids cramped bedroom on Tesco direct website. They were in the bank holiday offers and I boosted my vouchers. A few hours later  I received an email to tell me that the mattress was out of stock  even though there was no mention on the website that it was out of stock. I called up explaining that I still would like a mattress and to use my vouchers and to take advantage of the bank holiday offers. They emailed me a gift card code to use when I reordered. It took about 24 hours to come through. So once it came through I called up to place another order. They told me that the mattress that I ordered this time was in stock. I was happy until I received an email saying that it was out of stock. The customer service number is now closed so if I call tomorrow to get another gift card code  by the time I get the email  the bank holiday offers would have ended and I would have to pay full price again. I am very upset and angry  not at the staff on the phone  as they were fine  but it s the system and the website. I would have thought that the staff on the phone would have more of an insight into stock levels.  I am desperate now Tesco. What do you suggest I do next?

well i a not very happy with tesco click and collect... my daughter purchased an xbox 1 limited edition pack last monday... she was told it would be in store tuesday afternoon.. when she went to pick it up the extras she ordered were there but no xbox... after chatting to tesco they assured her it would be there wed.. but alas still nothing again a chat again thursday was promised... well u guessed nothing ... same friday.. so as u may imagine she is not very happy    well she got an email this morning saying it still wasnt going tot be there. no explanation.. she phoned and asked if there was any in any stores close by .. she got a call back yes 1 was available if she didnt mind driving a 40 odd mile round trip to collect it  she said ok and was offered a 10% refund... she got the xbox but the store was reluctant to give it her as the box and wrapping inside looked as if someone had taken a stanley knife to it... she took it any way and after 5 days of waiting she has her xbox... but she has to take it back and exchange on tuesday for an undamaged 1.. all the calls the travelling and she has in the end been offered a ¬£40 refund... to think what a large company tesco`s is and the customer service people don`t care letting people down a paltry refund and still no explanation as to why or even where the xbox is

I went to the large Tesco s by the Wicker to do some shopping and escape cabin fever. It s the only supermarket I know of in Sheffield with disability carts  as I am non weight bearing on my left leg  these enable to shop.  Unfortunately I was told by the lady staffing the customer service desk that the only working cart is in use. It meant my mum had to do the shopping. The point of the exercise was to persuade her I can be independent but it seems I am not. So she is meandering around a store she doesn t know looking for items on the list.   As we leave the store we find disability cart abandoned by an inconsiderate customer by the door  instead the parking spot for it. The trolley guy asked if I needed to use it and I explained that I hadn t been able to get some of the stuff I needed as I hadn t been able to get around. A manager came up with the key for it and said it had been in the office all day. He tried the key and the cart did not move  obviously the battery was discharged.   Both these latter staff did their best in the situation to remedy the lack of disabled accessibility and are a credit to Tesco s.   The sour note is that the staff member covering the customer service desk had misled me and also did nothing to remedy the situation. This had an impact on my response to the lack of helpfulness of Tesco On Line support  no excuse just honesty
Luke from the click and collect service in the dereham store was so pleasent and even helped me pack my shopping into my bags.   Such a credit to the store and the department.  üòÜ

To compound Tesco s poor customer service towards a disabled customer (me) in store today  their on line service support also failed to meet basic customer service levels.  I try to access my on-line account set up in the midst of time when I was hopping from address to address. I cannot remember what my password is. I use the reset password  which sends me a link  this requires my mregistration address postcode. I do not remember which address I was living at when I registered so no chance of remembering the postcode.  There s a telephone number which I call  once I find the actual right option I get through to a customer service agent  I explain that I cannot reset my password as I cannot remember my address at the time of registration and therefore the postcode. The call starts well with the taking of my email address  then I am asked for the first line of my address  that s right the address I have already told them I cannot remember. Explain that that is the problem  if I knew the address I could find the postcode. The respond was  well  I cannot help you if you don t give it . I lost my temper and shouted at her. She said she wasn t going to be shouted at. I requested a manager. I terminated the call when the old there is not a manager available you ll have to wait trick was pulled.  The response to I cannot change my password because I don t know what the answer is and then insisting on that piece of information showed that 1 - they had not listened to me  2 - they were working a tick box exercise and cannot think outside the box  I m sure I provide my mother s maiden and a security word when I registered so long ago  3 - they could not be bothered to assist a customer. I understand that measures need to be taken to ensure data security  but intransigence is not the answer.  I have now checked the postcodes of every address I ve lived at for the last 15 years  none of the post codes match; that s 7 post codes and 8 addresses.   Tesco s accessibility rating today is zero.  Asda s minimum on-line shop is ¬£25 so I will continue to use them for on line purchases and as Sainsbury s has a better local prescence in Sheffield use them in preference. It will not make a dent in Tesco s profits but it will make me feel better

I don t get it... how can I sign in to order groceries online with just my account email and password when my credit card details are saved within but if I want to check my clubcard points I have to login with the same AND have my clubcard to hand to enter some of my number for extra security?? Are clubcard points more susceptible to fraud than my credit card???!!!

Just like to say a massive thank you to Tesco in Watton. My sister is going through very gruelling chemotherapy at the moment which makes day to day tasks difficult. I can t be with my darling sister 24/7 I wish I could but knowing that there are genuine kind people out there willing to help makes such a difference.  Keep up the good work all of you and huge thanks again especially to Caroline.

Just wanted to say a huge thankyou to the level of customer services from the staff at Leicester Hamilton and also on the phone - we got to the checkout with a trolly full  handed over my latest vouchers along with my club card to be told that my vouchers had already been used! I was like huh! How! So the guy closed his till and walked me to the customer services till to find out what had happened  they were lovely and explained that I would need to call the number on my card as they were def saying  used in store  so I paid for my shopping  came home and rang club card  the person I spoke was friendly and polite and apologetic - think he said his name was Matt or Mark? After having a melt down last night  I wanted to say a massive thank you to Natalie who works at the opticians Askham Bar   York.  My son had his first driving test booked for today at 140 pm  and last night around 5pm our puppy decided to chew his glasses and we don t have a spare. I was worried that we would have to cancel his test but I hadn t bargained on Natalie coming to our rescue.  She said if we ordered them in they wouldn t be here in time but she looked through a box of glasses that they keep.  There looked to be hundreds of pairs but she looked through them and found a pair that she could put the lenses in. She said it would take about 20 minutes to fix swap them over so we went and did a bit of shopping. When we came back she said she couldn t get them in but she would ask Helen to do them in the morning and we could collect them after 9am. That was fine and off we went home. At 745 we received a call from Natalie saying she had done them!!! I would have kissed her had we been face to face.  We went in today at 930 am to be greeted by a lovely lady called Helen who asked if it was Daniel. When we said it was she was so kind to him wishing him well on his test. I just wanted to say a huge thank you to them both as they both went above and beyond to help us.   P.s. Daniel passed his test!!!!!!

So we recently moved from 150 yards from a Tesco Extra superstore to a town that has a Tesco Express petrol station and store. The great advantage of the Tesco Extra petrol stations for me is that my car is mapped for 99ron fuel so it only gets Momentum 99 or Shell Vpower. If I am stuck I can stretch to 97ron but just enough to get me elsewhere...  So imagine my surprise when I found the Tesco Express near me does not sell Momentum 99ron... Even though it s available at other petrol stations. Not only that but SuperUnleaded 97ron is nearly 10p a litre more expensive than 99ron at the supermarket... A total rip off. Fortunately for me there s a Shell Garage a little further out!  But what astounds me is the service at this particular store. There s always a queue in the store and never enough people on the tills. But what has really P****d me off is that there are 24hr pumps that are turned off when the store is shut! I arrived home from work late last night with a choice. I had enough fuel to get to Tesco or Shell.. Knowing Shell was 24hrs but Tesco had 24hr pumps and was nearer it was an easy decision... Until at 05:15 I m sat on the forecourt with all the pumps set to  kiosk only  and not enough fuel to get anywhere else.... Where is the logic in that???? It s totally irrelevant that I ran out of fuel trying to get to another fuel station and had to walk 2 miles in the rain when you consider just how much money you must be losing every day by this poor and inconvenient decision. If your going to insist on having 24hr pump facilities that aren t switched on 24hrs a day the least you can do is or a sign on them that states  not 24hrs   so people using them know that when they need fuel outside shop opening hours to go elsewhere. Or  if it was an error and they should be 24hrs someone needs a disciplinary.

I d like to thank tesco lunsford park for excellent customer care yesterday. I promised my son a cake in the cafe as a reward for excellent work at school. Only when we arrived the cafe was closing. Even though the cafe was closing. Thank you. I don t have your name but you made my sons day. It s the little things x

Dear Tesco   I am quite concerned with a recent click and collect purchase I ordered and would like you to answer and investigate what has happened.   I received an email stating my order was ready to collect from my local store as it had been scanned in at 12.50pm today. This was also evident through the parcel tracking service. However  going to the store this evening (8pm) I was told my the deputy store manager that the store did not have the parcel. He told me I should have a received store collection email and that I couldn t have as it wasn t there. As I argued my case for receiving one  he said he would call the helpline to track the parcel and came back saying they closed at 8pm?  I however  have just called (9pm) and spoke to a representative who confirmed for me the tracking states the parcel is with the store and could even tell me the staff members name it was signed in by. The call representative phoned the store for me herself and I was put on hold. She came back telling me the store was very adamant they did not have the parcel and the member of staff it was signed in by was apparently not even in store today as she is currently away on holiday. The call representative had no other option than to order a replacement as she herself was confused with the whole situation.  This makes me question whether a staff member at your store has faked this staffs signature as acceptance for the delivery whilst they are on holiday and stole it. I can not understand how it was signed and accepted for by a staff member who was not even working. How is the tracking telling me it has be scanned in at the store and the store have no recollection of this.  Please may you help me with this very confusing and mysterious problem.  Many thanks

I just want to say thank you to a couple of colleagues at your Cambridge  Milton branch. I went in today to pick up some bits with my daughter and nephew  both 19 months old. My daughter had a strop on and pretty much screamed from the second I put her in the trolley. She d been very poorly the week before and hasn t been herself since. I had about 20 minutes of stares and comments from customers and was at the point of a breakdown when a lovely member of staff came up to me! She asked if there was anything she could do to help and asked if I was ok! She could clearly see I was stressed so asked if she wanted me to hold on to my trolley or help me to the tills. I declined out of embarrassment but she took me to the tills anyway and unloaded all my shopping whilst I saw to my daughter. Another worker then came over and packed all my shopping and then asked if I needed him to take it to the car for me! They both showed genuine concern for me and my daughter and went out of their way to help! They helped make a seriously stressed mums day :)

I wanted to complain about a Tesco policy that makes me and many of my friends feel mistreated.  The fact that I cannot purchase any alcohol without an Irish drivers licence  an Irish ID card or a passport is simply discriminating.  I came from Germany to work here in Cork City. I pay my taxes  I m a responsible person and like to enjoy an evening after a rough day at the office with a glass of wine. Nothing wrong with that.  Nevertheless this is apparently a privilege that may be enjoyed by Irish habitants only. I am 25 years old and always have my European identity card with me. Not to mention that as being in Europe  I don t need to provide my passport to enter this country at the airport whatsoever. Hence it is not ensured that I even have a passport.  So why do I feel like an illegal immigrant when I am denied to purchase any kind of alcohol at Tesco.  It is humiliating and makes me feel less of a part of this Irish society in which I set foot.  For me there is no logical explanation for this policy but that Tesco only wants to have  real Irish  customers.  Thanks for reading this. Just something I needed to say.
Can you explain what the rationale is behind the phasing out of Irish products within your stores at a time when your rivals are expanding their selection to this lucrative niche market?

Just visited my local Tesco garage where myself and my children attend at least 3 times a week. I had run out of petrol and had to put some in. My daughter who always runs in to pay as I send her in because of the long Que. today however I had a sickness bug and also have spots I m assuming is related to chicken pox so didn t want to affect anyone else so made my 16 year old go in  she has been served petrol many times before so didn t see this as a problem before putting petrol in the car. On this attempt she was refused because of her school uniform (never have they been bothered before) as I walked into the store the cashier who was serving shouted out she was sorry but could serve someone underage since when is 16 underage to purchase petrol? I explained I had a sickness bug and she was 16 and I didn t want to infect anyone she carry on talking to me even through she had a customer.  I had to return to my car as my daughter had the cash however when I walked back into the store the cashier was telling another customer about myself and daughter loud enough for the whole line to hear.   I feel the service I received was unprofessional embarrassing and I will be telling people in the local area how appalling the store is in Chadwell st Mary s  grays.   I would also like to point out they have let my 10 year old pay for petrol in the past so if it s the case my 16 year old can t but my 10year old can I will be making a formal complaint to the relevant people.
Your ATMs at Bentley express are disgusting. They look like they ve never been cleaned and used by toddlers with sticky fingers since they were fitted.

Disgusted with the security guard in tesco Portland. In there shopping with my 13 year old son and his friend and when I went outside they were outside as they had been thrown out.  Apparently they were throwing a ball to each other when he came up and told them to get out. No warning just out! No even asking them to stop.  I told them outside they shouldn t be doing it and they understood that.  I took them back in the get the things they wanted whereby the security guard then proceeded to tell them to get out again. I explained they were with me and that I was supervising them.  So you think it was ok what they did he asked.  I told him I didn t and that I had told them off.  They were being disruptive he said in a busy store.  Really they were 6ft apart throwing a kids ball to each other.  Not acceptable I know but he could have at least warned them first. He was then rude to me said you re obviously a good parent then madam! They didn t even ask me if they could come back in he said. I told him I didn t know who had thrown them out so I couldn t ask him.  I asked him if they were banned  and he said no but you wouldn t think they would try to come straight back in! I said that is why I have come in with them! Absolutely disgusted with the the man rude and arrogant.  I wonder what he would have done if it was a toddler throwing a ball around.  Would he have thrown them out?

I rang up to find out if our store has a machine to print off our vouchers as ours haven t come yet and it was the only chance I had to pop and I was told the Grimsby store had the machine to print it off  so in I went but couldn t see the machine so I went to the Customer service desk who informed me they don t have one there but the Cleethorpes store (next nearest store) did have so the lady on the desk rang to check it was working before we attempted to go there and she was told it wasn t working  we then decided we would have to just wait for the vouchers to come through the post until she said us if we could get onto our clubcard account and she would see if they could do it that way although she had never tried it before  so we got onto my account and got the vouchers up that she was then able to scan  she could of just sent us on our way but you could see she was trying to help us as much as she possibly could and we were very grateful  Fantastic customer service x

Just wanted to say how well tescos rose lane Barnstaple were today during a power cut. Several shops around the area had lost power   a friend and myself were in one shop when power went down and the staff in that particular shop told us to put our shopping down and we had to leave the shop. We walked over to tescos who also had a power cut and they were running off back up generators   we done our shop and got what we needed  as we got to the tills we could only pay cash and there was a long wait.   Staff were absolutely amazing with all customers keeping them up to date with what s going on and helping out in every way possible. Just wanted to say a massive well done to all the staff there day and a big thank you for making the wait alot better! .

Hiya Tesco. Massive fail for customer service today at your Seacroft store. I left without what I needed and nobody helping me. I went in to print some photos. Easy you say! The photo machine either wasn t working or it wasn t clear how to select photos to print. I asked the nice lady in customer support. Over the course of the next 10 minutes she put 2 calls out for tech support. They are very elusive aren t they? After no one coming I asked where they were. She replied upstairs on electrical. So guess what? Your customer had to go up and get them...to be told by a lady that she was the only one there and would be 10 minutes. She seemed under pressure and got frustrated at my frustration (which is unacceptable) so I went back downstairs and asked the nice customer service lady for the duty manager to complain. Guess what?? They were too busy (now 25 minutes into my ordeal and late for work without photos) he told her to call another manager called Barry..who thankfully arrived promptly...and didn t know how to work the photo machine despite admitting his love of digital photography in his spare time. We both agreed that the machine either wasn t working or wasn t clear. Barry didn t know which. After 40 minutes  no photos and completely shocked by my experience I left the store. Barry took my name and number for a manager to call and apologise... Now an hour late for work and was even made to Pay for my lunch instead of it being offered as a good will gesture for my experience. Not I have no Photos which were urgent for my business and its cost me money. Well done Tescos!

I was at the checkout in my local Tesco Metro store in Rosyth yesterday afternoon. I have recently had a baby and while trying to pack my shopping away my daughter was fairly unsettled so while packing I was also trying to settle the little one. As such I was taking a little longer than usual  however I would have thought given the circumstances this would be ok. However  while still packing the assistant began to serve the next customer. He did only have one item so the assistant maybe just thought she would quickly deal with it  however she then began to serve the next customer in the queue before I had managed to finish packing my shopping onto my pram. I felt so rushed I decided to leave the checkout area and push the pram and shopping to the small seating area near the desks to sort it out properly. I appreciate I may have taken longer than normal to get through the checkout but I feel that it is wrong that I was made to feel rushed  specially with a newborn baby. I would like to add that although I took a bit longer it was nowhere near an excessive amount of time and I was not asked if I would like any help with my packing.The checkout assistant was fairly young and possibly did not appreciate that it is stressful enough to shop with a newborn  however I would have thought that while training  this may be something that was mentioned. I would really hate this to happen to any other new mums.

Tesco  iv got to say that I am really disappointed in the communication skills of my local store. I have been a regular shopper for a very long time and wanted to see if you would be interested in  giving back  to the local community. After numerous visits to the store and a trip with the school in which I work to go  behind the scenes  I see a lot of promotion of the community champion and the great work They do locally. However I am now raising money for a little girl in my family with a rare and severe disorder to fund private treatment that could enable her to walk and to donate to the charity reverse rett. I have tried to contact the community champion via email more than once  been in store and spoken to people who would  pass my details on  and also spoke to someone on the helpline who spoke with the store manager who took my number off of them and assured them they would call me  right away . Needless to say I still haven t been contacted by anyone and the event is fast approaching. Even if no help could be offered a simply response would have been great. I am not putting the blame on the champion  as I was told they were only allocated certain hours to work in that area. It s just a shame that you promote  getting involved in the community  but yet it s impossible for a local person to get in contact. Regards

tesco car insurance courtesy car cover.so you take out courtesy car cover on your policy have a non fault claim phone up to claim and are told to call albany assistance who will provide a car .call them up sorry mr jones as you didnt get the registration of the car that hit you i cant proceed any further please get reg no and get in contact with tesco car insurance nothing we can do.get the reg no and call back tesco car insurance and tell them what albany said .ok so now they have the full details of other driver sorry mr jones you cant have a courtesy car as it looks like youre cars a write off  and you dont get a car if yours is a total loss.3 weeks down the line no car and im told o were repairing your old car but still no offer of a courtesy car or apology for not supplying 1 three weeks ago.never in my 25 years of driving only i at fault claim in all this time have i had to deal with such unhelpful non caring insurance poeple.so if you have courtesy car cover dont expect to get a car  be warned.

Tesco. You ve let us down!  I saw an advert for your party platters. Usually I order from a different chain of stores (who had always supplied exactly what I ve ordered  incidentally) but thought I d give you a try... So I ordered 3 weeks ago. Plenty of notice I presumed  for collection between 10-12 today- her party starts at 1pm. My husband gets there to collect (his only job tbh  I figured he couldn t get it wrong) and the man very politely informs him that there s been some substitutions on my order... That s right. Substitutions on an order that I finalised weeks ago- knowing that they d be specially ordered in and that there was a 3 days order time on them.   Now I m left having to take substitutions I didn t want because I don t have any choice  and I ve got to somehow make enough sandwiches for the children that are coming to her party!  Absolutely ridiculous that no one thought to let me know before hand that you couldn t  provide what I d ordered so I had a chance to find what I needed somewhere else! That s why I have a mobile number on my account.   Safe to say I ll stick to my preferred shop for these things from now on!

Last Tuesday I purchased a ticket for the top car wash i typed in the code and drove forward  the car wash was not working  I then had an irate customer behind me bibbing and swearing at me because I was not getting my car washed? I could not drive forward as the light was on red and did not want to risk my car being damaged  I rang the main tesco line which the girl said was cardiff and then asked for someone from the Wrexham garage to come out and assist as I  was stuck and had an angry customer behind me! eventually the lady came out  she said the car wash was on a code 33  was broke and they were having a new car wash in June  she returned in the garage to get a refund but came out with another token  she did something in the wall with a key and the machine started up she then gave me a return wash for the carwash ...however  the car was filthy after I had gone through the wash so i drove to customer service to explain all this again  and asked for a refund  and explained the free return wash was no good as the machine was broke and didn t wash the car properly  the lady told me to shop then return to customer services  on doing this I was given a ¬£5 gift card?! less than what  I had paid out.. and no cash refund? By this point I was totally fed up so didn t argue! but on going to use the card it hadn t even been activated!! so I ve lost out on my money and had a great deal of hassle!!
You should withdraw any advertising for charities that advocate testing on animals !! SHAME ON YOU TESCO !!!

To whom it may concern  During my Saturday evening  myself and my employer decided to take a trip to tesco in rugby as we were feeling a little peckish. During this time it was very cold  blizzard like outside so was an unusually long journey. We were thankful you were open as our regular  Asda  was closed until the morning.  As we arrived at tesco we were greated by a very polite security guard. Walking down the Isles I decided it was the sweets I craved and wanted to fulfil this empty space with what is call  mega mouth spray .  I jumped for joy when the excitement of seeing it on your shelf.  I grabbed with all my strength and we made our way to the til area.. Self service to be exact. I scanned my items  paid  collected my receip and off we went to the car for your yet long blizzard like journey home. As my employer was driving  I decided to open my  mega mouth spray  and spray the first spray...  To my discovery I realised nothing was coming out.. I looks again and checked and to my discovery I found this was empty. This had caused me much upset and emotional pain. When I further looked into why this may be the case  I discovered it had a crack in the bottom and this was result in my empty sweet. I ve now had to result in going to bed with an empty space  knowing the struggle of sleeping tonight.  I hope you are well aware of the issue this has now caused me and disappointment of now ever shopping at tesco.  Please can you advise me on the next step to take this investigation further. Kind regards Ella

Can I suggest that you start putting the total amount of carbohydrates in an item of food on the front of the packaging alongside calories  fat etc. I ve just bought a sandwich which has the nutrition values per 100g but doesn t actually state the weight of the item and as a type 1 diabetic  I now have to workout exactly how many carbs are in this sandwich before eating it. Realistically  it s not that hard to do but when you have to do it before eating anything it s a real inconvenience. Hardly any of your food items have the total amount of carbs displayed in the nutrition and it is even worse when something is a part of a multipack and doesn t have full nutrition information on it. Please consider changing your packaging and it would make mine and probably so many other type 1 diabetic customers lives a lot easier  as we could actually eat our food straight away without having to faff about with carb counting!!

I would like to commend you on your attempt to cut vegetable waste with the Perfectly Imperfect range  I bought the parsnips on Friday. Thing is anyone would be hard pushed to see why these were imperfect. You are really missing the point. I would like to thank the store manager and Deputy store manager in the Llandrindod Wells branch today  who both took the time to talk to me  on a particularly busy Saturday morning  in store.  I made them aware of the five Devon stores who have introduced the practice of placing pint cartons of milk with other drinks next to sandwiches  regarding which an article had been written in this week s Farmers Weekly. This had proved such a success that consideration was being given to rolling this out nationally.   The store is one of the main choices of lunch for children from the local High School  and they were willing to listen to my comments regarding the fact that children would be more likely to drink milk that was easily accessible. Also  with milk being one of the only two safe drinks for teeth  ideal for if to be offered in this manner.  Thank you Tesco....look forward to seeing this in store....and possibly considered elsewhere?  #milkandsarnies

Not very impressed with your new website layout for clubcard. Very awkward to use  and u have to go into each attraction/ item before you can see what the deal is. Very frustrating. If you go into one then want to come out  it kicks u out of the search. Hard Work  and very frustrated!!!!

Hi there.  I use your newtownabbey store regularly. could you please invest in a few more of those wee car/trolleys as you only have two there. Last week my wife and 2 year old daughter went shopping  the two car/trolleys were in use. We told our daughter who was not amused that we were going for a coffee 1st anyway and hopefully there would be one available by the time we had finished.  5 mins later we sat down with with our coffee and at that moment I spotted the car/trolley emerging from a checkout. I can see one  ill go and get it I said to my daughter (daddy the hero).  I could see there was a young lady who had two kids with her  I didn t want to rush her so instead of asking could I have it after her I thought I would wait until she had discarded it. I then found myself stalking this young lady from checkout to car. As she passed me at the main door I didn t make eye contact instead I pretended to be on the phone.I looked over at my daughter who was waiting for her daddy to return and I thought   what if another dad was watching and waiting  I had to get closer.  So after a few james bond like car park menouvers I found myself casually walking by as the young lady placed the last bag of shopping in the boot.   could I have that  I asked in calm and collected manner.  Yes sure she replied  oblivious to the mission that I had just completed in the lead up to this question.  As I pushed the trolley through the main entrance I could almost hear the whole store and my daughter cheer me as if I had saved Christmas.  Of course there was no cheering but a huge smile from my daughter was thanks enough.  Anyway back to the point   as I fear one day even my james bond manoeuvres may not be enough to ensure a pleasent shopping trip. Please invest in a few more car/trolleys as 2 is not enough.   Thanks

Ridiculous. I bought a bottle of single malt whisky this morning at Tesco Nailsea. I didn t do this for a while because I found the wait  while the bottle was retrieved  a bit off-putting. Perhaps a few people did  because the bottles are back in the boxes these days. Due to an oversight  for which I blame nobody (for we are fallible  and to err is human  to forgive divine)  the security tag was not removed from my Dalwhinnie  so the alarm sounded as I left the shop. I returned to the store  receipt in hand  and went to Customer services. Unfortunately  I was not able to attract anyone s attention. Had I the patience of Job  and no son to pick up in three minutes  time  I should have waited until all customers were served  all cigarette packets straightened and all watches checked. As it was  I stood in the barriers  waving my arms and calling  Hello?  hello? Can anyone help me?  as the alarm sounded. Answer came there none  so I gave up and left  the cacophony receding as I strolled into the car park. This is the second time this has happened - the first instance playing out identically to today s. Con artists! That s what you are #tesco! I received my letter through the post weeks ago and waited patiently for the  last ever  clubcard boost. Been saving my vouchers and was really pleased to learn that my chosen item was included in the boost. So at 8am on Monday I logged into my account on put my chosen item in my basket - A Dyson V8 Animal Cordless. The price had mysteriously been  boosted  too but I didn t mind too much because I was using vouchers. Unfortunately once the item was in my basket I got a notice to say that the item was no longer in stock and I could  save  it for later. I tried the V8 Absolute as an alternate but got the same result. So today I thought I d check to see if the product was back in stock. It s there  reduced by ¬£70 back to the pre-boost price and it s been taken off the offer. How can you do this? It s not even been a week. Does anyone actually get to buy these items or do you falsely advertise popular items  then pretend they re out of stock so that you don t actually have to honour the promotion. I have read the T&C s and I understand that Tesco reserves the right to withdraw items  but at least sell some first. Or hold enough stock volume to cover the first day of the promotion. What am I saying! YOU DO HAVE STOCK! You re just a bunch of con artists. Please remember that I did have to buy from Tesco over a prolonged period in order to collect these vouchers. What a way to thank your customers for their loyalty! #irked

How different experiences in different stores can be; a little while ago my son and I visited the caf√© in Tesco Long Eaton. That day there was a problem with the chiller cabinets and so many choices weren t visible. When I asked if a salad was on the menu  the staff were very helpful and a delicious ham salad was made up for me.  Today  for the first time  we went into the caf√© at the Beeston store. No sign of salad  I ask and get a puzzled look and a suggestion that maybe they could  put some lettuce and cucumber on a plate with one of the main courses.  That no store does a plated salad. I suspect my first time in here will be my last.  I was disappointed with the lack of healthy choices; the reason I wanted the salad was some idea of what is in the food. All of the available dishes seemed to be laden in cheese (macaroni or lasagna) or in soggy looking pastry. My son had the Mac...it comes with chips...and baked beans (no peas left  it s not even 1pm yet!). The server  upon hearing my concern  rudely pointed at the jacket potatoes - he said I should get that...they come with tuna in full fat Mayo  cheese...or beans (I don t like those).  Now  I think I shall be heading downstairs to the grocery department to find a pot of salad  or maybe some sushi...

I think you should train your staff more with regards to ages / asking for ID.  After work  I had picked my husband up and we went to our local tesco for tonight s tea and tomorrow s lunch. Tonight s tea we decided on the meal deal which came with a side dish  dessert and a bottle of wine. Quite clearly an adult type of shop and being as we are both nearly 30 (and look around our age) were surprised when we got asked for ID. My husband had his  but I didn t have mine. Because of that  the woman had to reverse most of the shop that we had put through.   Now I understand having to ask for ID  I understand people fear their jobs for potentially serving underage. I understand that the  ask 25  was brought in to have a reason to ask for ID to those who look over 18  but may not be - it s a safe thing to do.  But come on Tesco  surely your staff should have at least a little bit of common sense about them?!  In this example - you have a couple with wedding rings on  one with ID stating they are 29  the other with car keys in hand paying with a credit card that states  mrs  buying a meal deal that comes with a bottle of wine - not a basket full of vodka... very obvious that they are over the age of 18 and are legal to purchase alcahol - the cashier may not have been sure if we were over 25 years old  but surely - common sense and not being a complete jobsworth should have taken over at this point?!  As I said - please give your staff some training rather than just having them ask everyone for ID. The amount of ridiculous stories I hear  but to be personally truly frustrated at a person who is a representative of Tesco... it has made me not want to shop there if I don t happen to have my ID on me on the way home from work - I may not be able to purchase deodorant spray  candles maybe  or even plastic knives?! Where does it stop.

Warning to customers re sandwiches!!   Well after two days of food poisoning I m finally able to write this post. I have had diarrhoea  vomiting  stomach cramps  the sweats and not been able to tolerate either food or fluids. I have already had to miss two days at work  which will be five days by the time I am 48hrs clear. For which I will not be paid!!!!   This was all due to a prepacked prawn sandwich I purchased at the tescos store on saffron lane in Leicester. I know the sandwich was the cause as it was the only thing I ate on Monday morning approx 6 hours before the symptoms started.   I appreciate that tesco must follow all food hygiene regulations but at some point during either the preparation or  Storage of this sandwich it has either been contaminated or the storage temps have not been correct. With a high risk food product such as prawns I find this very scary.
Oh tesco.   Every time I try to shop with you your website won t work.   I can t book a delivery slot or a collection.  Guess I ll go back to asda who will allow me to do so üò°

This was the first time I have been to Tesco for glasses and rest assured I will not go back again where i usually go will replace any part of my glasses which has a fault within the first 12 months not that i have ever needed to as their quality of glasses is obviously better.

Why do the vast majority of your own brand food products contain palm oil? It s cheap  I suppose is the answer. But does being competitive on price come above the planet and causing extinction of animals like orangutang and Sumatran Tigers? Once they are gone  they are gone. But we ll still have Tesco.  If you must use palm oil  could it not at least be sustainable palm oil and not the sort responsible for the desolation of the worlds rainforests?

So Helston Tesco have removed this post from their page  due to guilty minds. So I m now posting it on here......  I visited the Helston Tesco store this evening with my local Beavers group. Although the other kids had a good time  my son on the other hand didn t. You were given notice that my son has Coeliac Disease  therefore would not been able to join in making bread  yes  he said he d wear gloves  but how could a 6 year old enjoy making bread with gloves that were even too big for adults and the fact he would be making a bread to take home  he couldn t even eat?! Yes  he got upset and I had to take him out of the room  because he couldn t understand why he couldn t enjoy it like the others. After calming him down  he then kind of enjoyed the rest of the visit. And then....low and behold  when giving the other children their bread  my son was given NOTHING!! It wasn t until other parents were offering to go and buy him something from the Free From section in front of the lady leading the visit  she then unwillingly went across to the staff cafe  and got him a banana and a pot of fruit!  I mean seriously  a pot of fruit!  which would never of been given to him if it wasn t for other parents aiming hints!! Where was the harm in just getting him a loaf of bread which was just downstairs from his section and put in a bag so he wasn t made to feel different and left out!! I am completely disappointed and angry that yet again my son was pushed out  and not by his choice. This is a medical condition  not a choice! He is 6 and still doesn t quite understand  and people wonder why he gets so upset!! Absolutely disgusting. No reason at all why something wasn t arranged for him considering the amount of notice given. Safe to say  I WILL NOT be visiting your store again!!

Hi Tesco   I d like to express my gratitude and bring to your attention the recent service I received at one your stores. from A.  (I ve been informed I can t name the store or actual person for legal reasons)  A went over and beyond in customer service with a recent dilemma I was faced with when trying to work out how best to order food for my sons christening.  The christening was to take place on a Sunday morning however I needed to be able to set the food up at the venue prior to the church service at 10.30am.  I wanted to order fresh food and collect/receive it as close to the actual morning as I could. Having absolutely no family locally or anyone to call upon that wasn t going to be at the christening themselves  A was my absolute hero of the day.  He suggested I order the food online for the first delivery slot of the actual day and he personally would speak to the online team regarding me collecting it from store instead of it going out on the lorry.  As the day drew nearer and the online team not being sure my order would be processed in time  A decided he didn t want to leave it to chance. He came into work on his day off and personally said  if the order wasn t ready for me to collect by 9am  he would deliver it direct to the venue himself.  This true act of kindness was overwhelming to me. It prevented such worry as to how I would a) sort all the food myself and b) if anything went wrong on the day. He simply took my worries away. I couldn t be more grateful. This was exceptional service and the party food quality was lovely  everyone was commenting on the day.  Please pass on my thanks and appreciation to A  a credit to your store and a great person. Thank you x
