I am so  so fed up with trying to shop at my local Tesco in Northallerton. The stocking system there is completely broken - things seem to sell out within about a day and take between a week and a month to be restocked again. There are always gaps upon gaps on the shelves. I can literally never get more than about 2/3 of the things on my list. The gluten free section is always run right down  often I can t get the pasta or the Warburton s wraps. Soy yoghurt is sold out half the time. I ve just waited three weeks for dark Chocologic to be available again. Almost any time I go in towards the end of the afternoon (4pm onwards) when most people want to do their shopping  there is a lamentable shortage of fresh fruit and vegetables. Salad bowls  celery sticks  fresh strawberries or raspberries all keep selling out. Two days ago you finally brought in cauliflower couscous  which I adore - today it s gone again.  I m seriously considering giving up and switching to Sainsbury s  even though it s further to walk...

Has anyone else had this happen? I tried to place an online order on Sunday 15th May.  My password was not recognised so I clicked that I forgot my password  where it said I should get an e-mail to reset it within 15 minutes.  I waited an hour and no e-mail. Soooo..... I repeated the process and got the same  again no e-mail after an hour. I phoned Customer Services who said the system might just be slow and wait longer.  I did wait longer  until the next day in fact.  On Monday 16th I still had no e-mail so phoned Customer Support again.  The woman said she would personally send me an e-mail with the link to reset password  and did while I was on the phone to her.  She said it should come within 15 minutes.  I waited an hour again and still no e-mail.  I phoned Customer Services again to check they had my e-mail correctly.  They did.  I also had checked my junk mail folder  and my blocked list  and Tesco were not in either.  They put me through to  a computer or I.T. team .  The guy said he would cancel my account completely and then I could simply re-register online; he said I could try in 4 hours time but that it could take up to 24 hours.  I did try after 4 hours  no luck  so left it 27 hours.  On Tuesday 17th (today) I tried to re-register online and it said my e-mail was already registered.  I tried to re-register with another e-mail address I use but it said my Clubcard was already registered.  So much for my account being cancelled??  I phoned Customer Services.  Not a happy bunny that it has so far taken me 3 days to try and place an order.  Customer Services said they dont know why this is happening but would ring me back.  Lady phoned me back to say that my account HAD NOT BEEN CANCELLED the day before (Tesco  why not??) and that she would do it right now while I was on the phone.  She said to wait 24 hours and then re-register.  I told her that is exactly what I was told yesterday.  That will be 4 DAYS TO PLACE AN ORDER!!!  I thought  Goodbye Tesco  you are having a laugh!  ; but then the Customer Services lady told me that I might not have blocked Tesco myself but that my e-mail provider might have blocked Tesco.    I am trying to be patient and not blame Tesco  but has anyone else heard of this before?  Has anyone else had Tesco blocked but not by themselves?  How can I check if Tesco is blocked when they do not appear on my blocked list?

Dearest Tesco   Today I awoke with a real hankering for some egg & onion sandwiches  so I though to myself  Ah  Tesco have a whole new range of fruit & veg in so I ll go and get myself some . So off I skip to my nearest store  money in hand to buy my goods. I get to the store and see before me a wide range of lovely fresh fruit. Scan my eyes to the right and see another mouthwatering display of fresh vegetables....but wait.... where are the onions?? I search and search but cannot find them. I see a member of staff putting out that mornings delivery so I thought  Ah they just haven t put them out yet . Alas the lovely employee sadly informed me that you did not supply the store with onions. :( no brown  no red  no shallots  not even ready chopped! So here I sit  typing this out  eating my lonely egg sandwich with a tear running down my cheek  thinking of the onion that might have been. Now I know some might say that I could have went somewhere else  however where I live  my closest store is a Tesco express. I know that  express  stores have limited stock availability but considering that  it is the only store that isn t a 3 mile camel ride away I think you are missing out on a winner here. So I beg you Tesco  please supply my local with our beloved onions! Plus I m pretty sure this is discrimination of the onion lovers! Kind regards  One lonely egg sandwich <3

I have had an absolutely infuriating experience with Tesco. On the 27th April I went to collect a PS4 click-and-collect from your Manford Way Tesco Express. When I arrived  the box had already been opened and I was offered a refund. I took the PS4 to test whether it was okay  and after a couple of weeks had worked out there were some problems with both the HDMI and ethernet port.  I called Tesco Direct on the 13th May to get an exchange for a new  fully-working PS4 and I requested an on-the-doorstep exchange for today. I later received an e-mail telling me the item was being sent to the Manford Way store. When I called up and queried why it was not being sent to my home  I was told they were unable to change it and that I would have to pick it up from the store.  A later e-mail informed me that it would be delivered to the store between 10:36am and 11:36am. I arrived after this time  and was told that the delivery had not come and that I should return at 3pm. When I returned after 3pm  I was told that the delivery had been signed for but that the item had been returned and was no longer in the store. The staff were very unhelpful and unsympathetic  and told me to go to the Barkingside store  either to swap the PS4 for a new one there  or to speak to their customer service to resolve the issue (rather than the Manford Way staff dealing with the problem). I spoke to a very pleasant and helpful lady called Tracy there  who tried her very best to get in contact with Manford Way and find out the problem. However  the store would not answer their phone. After being there for about an hour and a half  Tracy had obtained that Suget from Manford Way signed for the item at 10:42am (an hour BEFORE I was told that the item was not in store) and I went back to Manford Way with this information because no one could get in contact with them from Barkingside customer service.  I returned and spoke to the Manford Way manager  who had no idea what had happened to the item. She rang Suget  and handed me the phone to talk to him directly. He told me  they took it back  with no details of who or why. After a long wait  I was told by the manager that they had rung Tesco Direct and that I would be able to obtain a new one. I left the store  rang Tesco Direct and was told that they had received no such call or information. I am still waiting for them to return my call  despite assuring me they would call back within the hour.  I had planned this evening with my friends centred around my new PS4  so not only has my day been wasted  my evening has been ruined too. I am appalled by the lack of care and attention taken by Manford Way staff towards me and my problem. I have wasted both time and money  as well as a day off of work  pursuing my PS4 which has apparently vanished into thin air. I have never experienced such a disregard for customer satisfaction and correct procedure. I work in retail myself and I cannot fathom how such unbelievable inattentiveness can be tolerated in a store such as yours.

With particular reference to my personal experience at 21:38 on Friday 13/05/2016 at the Falkirk Camelon Road (Rosebank) Tesco Express / Esso shop I was immediately confronted by an older female Tesco shop assistant who declared that I was barred from entering the shop.  I have no idea whatsoever of the foundation of this radical claim and so I asked for an explanation.  She assumed I was another person therefore  for she briefly mentioned of an incident whereby a person had been accosted (sic) outside the shop  but after my repeated request of at what time and date I was not informed.  Within seconds of her choosing to enter into a dialogue with me  she resumes serving customers at the tills alongside at least two other staff members yet claimed I was interrupting the customer.  Several minutes later she claimed she was going to check a database to verify the identity of the actual barred person.  Her tone and attitude throughout was insistent of her assertation that I could not possibly be some other person and arrogant.   It felt somewhat like a medieval public flogging.  I am ashamed of Tesco at the complete failing of the judgement of the shop assistant (and moreover the fact no colleague intervened because there was doubt of my identity).  I will from now on feel apprehension of entering any Tesco shop as a result.  If given the opportunity to clear my name at the time  it would have given my continued freedom to enter this particular shop.  I was unable to have any resolution to the accusation  and therefore I deem it an act of slander.  I felt utterly humiliated and indignant having had a public display of apparent wrong-doing.  I am very serious in what I say and I expect you solemn consideration on this matter of utmost importance.  My next steps will include Social Media and potentially instructing of my lawyer regarding this matter.  I await your full and prompt response.

I went to your caledonian road branch on thursday and I was in a rush with work and needed something i could take on the tube to eat. I am coeliac so went to the free from section  the only thing i could take was biscuits so i noticed finest spicy ginger cookies i took one of the several pacs there. I ran for my train and started eating the biscuits.   i had eaten two before i realised they were ordinary biscuits and had been put in wrong section.  I am now quite ill as my guts have been damaged by the gluten. Whilst I clearly should have read the label better the issue was caused by your staff putting ordinary food in with all the free from food. Coeliacs are very careful and I do read labels but when in a store you trust with a free from section you expect it to be free from products  sometimes we are in a rush and this can mean we put our trust in you.   Please ask all your stores to check the free from sections and remove items that should not be there. This is an chronic illness and I know I will be sick for some time due to this.

I  would like the HE department and the Manager of Tesco in Sale to know that they have wonderful staff.  The lady on the customer services desk who held my hand and gave me tissues when I cried during an anxiety attach earlier today. My car had a puncture in the car park.  Sean was without a knight in shining armour.  He talked to me gently to help calm me and told me about his sister who has anxiety   he was so very kind.  He then took me back to the car park   collected his own jack  wheel brace and air pump.  He changed my wheel swopped them around and then checked the air pressure in all my tyres because he knew I needed to feel safe. I m still feeling a little shaky but I m home safe and sound.  In a world quick to criticise I want es to compliment and thank Sean   I  don t know how I would have coped without historic help and understanding.  It s goods to know that mental health issues are already being understood by big corporate companies like Tesco.  Tesco you are fortunate to employ such a superstar as Sean.  Please arrange a pat on the back for him   he went above and beyond. It wasn t an Every Little that helped   it was enormous.  Thank you.

I am pregnant which made the whole episode worse for me but am thankful that I didn t have my toddler in the car. I did have a passenger witness though who was equally shocked and appalled.  Sadly the position of his vehicle didn t allow me or my passenger to get his number plate but I d recognise him again and when I do  his photo will be going to the police along with my report of his dangerous driving and law breaking. I trust you will take a report of such an incident seriously and remind your drivers that they are not above the law.

Hello.  I can t find the right place to feedback on your website so I m going to do it here!  I was sat at your click and collect site in New Malden today (which is fabulous - I love the ladies there)  watching a man put individual items into his own bags because he didn t want to pay 40p for the plastic bags (or he cares for the environment of course which is equally possible) and it struck me that he was putting groceries from your store into competitors bags when he could have been putting them into your bags for life. I wonder if you would consider therefore setting up a scheme at the click and collect stations where customers could have the option of buying bags for life when they shop online.  You could pack the shopping into the bags for life.  Then the next time we bring back the empty bags for life and you give us the shopping in more bags for life.  And so on.  Like we used to with the milk bottles when we were kids!  I appreciate that sometimes people would forget their bags so sometimes more bags might end up out than in but perhaps it would be worth trialing.  It would probably be a scheme that people buy into rather than buying the bags individually.  The ladies at New Malden seemed to think it would make their lives a whole lot easier.  Food for thought?  And sorry if I ve put this in entirely the wrong place!

Bought a PS4 from Tesco at Christmas.  Broke once  got it repaired  broke again  returned for a refund.  All good so far  but wait .... Having phoned customer services off we drive to the local store to return the PS4 and arrange a refund.  So a very nice lady at the local store gets onto Customer Services  who action the refund but before you can say  knife  - problem is they did it without checking with me HOW I would like the refund.  I tried to intervene  but no ... don t interrupt our process  click  it s done.  Money has been returned to the card on which you paid.  Great  but I was trying to say I don t want it refunded to that because the account is closed!     Lady at store says don t worry  check the email and you will be able to call the number on the email.  However  no number ... so another drive back to the same lady at the local store who phones Customer Services  who say they can t do anything - my Bank will have to transfer the money into the correct account. (Lady at store now embarrassed at how unhelpful Customer Services are).   Next morning I am at the Bank  who tell me they can t just transfer money from a payee to any account I say without reference back to the payee - could be fraud.  Fair enough!  (Note how reasonable and patient I am being).  I need to give Tesco the new account number  so that once the payment is bounced back to them they can pay it.   This afternoon (that s 24 hours now since problem first arose) I am on to Tesco again.   oh no  they say  we can t do anything without the previous account details.   ok  says I - I have the account number and sorting code you sent the money to.  But NOOO -  that s not good enough!  they say  we need the card number  they say.  The account is flipping closed  says I  I don t have the old card number it was destroyed.   Go back to your bank  says Tesco  they ll sort it out .  So now I am spitting feathers!  They won t budge an inch - keep passing the buck back to me.  Everyone else manages to transfer money using a sorting code and account number  but that s not good enough for Tesco apparently!   SO  now I have no PS4  no refund and will have to spend my Saturday afternoon seeing if my Bank can help me. TESCO S SUCKS!!!  I am never shopping there every again.

Dear Tesco   Order: 322312060 I have this morning received my order from you and realised for the second time since doing my online shopping with you  that the amendments that I had made to my original order  before the 11.45pm deadline  have not been made  and thus the changes have not been reflected in my delivery. The first time this happened I put it down to my error  however today I was convinced that I had received the green order confirmation banner last night  just after 10pm  to confirm that my amendments had been made. In order to save my sanity  I logged into your site to check the items in my delivery  and received an error message to state that the changes had not been able to be made as the order was already being processed. We contacted your Customer Services department who were extremely helpful and agreed to take our issue up with your technical teams. As agreed they then called us back  to advise that your technical team had advised that this was a  known issue  where intermittently  orders amended after 10pm which are being delivered early (10am?!) did not get updated. You can imagine how shocked I was to hear that you are aware of this issue  however still allow customers to make changes way after this time. I would be grateful of an explanation please as to why this is being allowed to happen and why you think the refund of the delivery charge and a ¬£10 voucher is satisfactory compensation for an order that clearly isn t what I was expecting.  Many thanks.

I would just like to thank the nicest Tesco delivery man I‚Äôve ever spoken to. Tonight  not only did I miss my delivery slot (I was in the gym  instead of being at home)  I also discovered that my food delivery was sent to my sister‚Äôs flat in Exeter instead of mine in London! The series of events started when the lovely gentleman called up saying that he‚Äôs outside my house. I panicked  realising I had forgotten and I was ten minutes away. He told me not to worry and that he will continue with the other deliveries  then for me to call him once home and he would come back to deliver my food. I was so taken by his kindness that on the way home that I bought some chocolates for him to say sorry. Once home I called him and he said he would be there in 3 minutes. I waited by my front door and then received a phone call. He told me he was outside. Puzzled  I explained I was also by my door. It wasn‚Äôt until he started reading out my sister‚Äôs address in Devon that I realised that not only was I late for my delivery  it was a delivery that for some reason was in Devon  not my address in London. I frantically apologised saying that it was my sister‚Äôs address. He told me not to worry and was happy to wait whilst I called her to check if she was in. Unfortunately  she wasn‚Äôt and I called back to explain. I apologised for messing things up  however  he kept telling me not to worry. I couldn‚Äôt believe just how understanding and kind he was. He then gave me help by telling me how to contact the customer services so that it could be rectified. Now I‚Äôm sitting here  with no food  except a box of chocolates meant for that lovely man. However  I‚Äôm overcome by how nice this Tesco employee was  and it‚Äôs given me a little faith in humanity. If we could all be as kind as him  the world would be a much nicer place. Thank you so very much to that incredibly nice man. Please can you try to reach this exceptional employee and thank him for me.

Just went to Tesco and was told they no longer give small bags for fresh packaged meat!! I was told I had to pay 5p for a carrier. The carrier would then have to be thrown as it would contain fresh meat. I have found the policy about this below  . Bags of a certain size used solely to contain packaged uncooked meat  poultry and fish: As well as the above exemption on unpackaged foods  there is no obligation to charge if the bag is used solely to contain packaged uncooked fish or fish products  packaged uncooked meat or meat products or packaged uncooked poultry or poultry products. This exemption only applies where the bag is less than 206mm (width) x 459mm (height including handles) with a maximum gusset of 125mm.  When customer service phoned the lady said it is policy to pay for carriers and I kept saying I didn t ask for a carrier but she was talking over me. Yes I got annoyed who wouldn t when a lady is speaking over me and telling me to just pay they don t give away bags even when I pointed out the policy on bags. Shame on you Tesco you make enough money out of the public without charging for small bags for fresh meat and fish. Have you advertised where you send the money you take from the carriers as I haven t seen it anywhere

Dear Tesco   I am writing to make a full complaint and request that you launch an investigation in to what happened.  I am utterly disgusted  shocked and angry about comments made by a member of your staff to my friend s mother. The incident occurred in your Hucknall store and it was concerning the sexuality of Brandon  my friend.  My friends mother  who is a regular  long-standing customer of Tesco was approached by a member of your staff who she knows  only to be told  you should feel disappointed in your son turning out gay!   I am absolutely astounded that a member of your staff who work in a big corporation would openly air their views like this. She clearly thinks this is acceptable  much to her amazement  it s clearly not.  My friend felt like he was being judged  for simply being himself  as he is doing his weekly shop with mother.  I look forward to hearing from you at your earliest inconvenience  with a comprehensive list of the action you are going to take in to the investigation around this.  Yours sincerely   Anton Cane A very angry and 20 year customer of Tesco.

Dear Tesco    I have recently visited your Sprowston Tesco store with the sole purpose of purchasing comfort food and cough sweets to improve my partner s mood; she was suffering with a sore throat.   I wandered the aisles aimlessly looking for a remedy  and arguably more importantly I wanted to get some well deserved respite.  As a bloke I had to do the obligatory sweep past the magazines; taking a peek at car magazines. I then pondered  and considered buying an Xbox or a Playstation; finally deciding that I couldn t make my mind up. In reality  i was only kidding myself as I thought of carnage at home  if I had returned with either. I resigned to the fact that no matter how I explained it  or how I sold it. That it was a particularly bad idea  and I might as well have signed my own death warrant. Figuratively speaking.   Looking at the time I decided that I really should start searching for the remedy for an easy life  albeit in this case a cure for the missus s sore gullet. I spent the next 10 minutes trying to decide which flavour of cough sweets would best suit the boss  and I wisely chose the cherry flavour. I figured that if she didn t like them  then I would. Not all would be lost  I felt fairly smug about my perspicacious judgment in this matter. I proceeded to choose a cake with aplomb; lavishly picking up the luxury chocolate cake. I knew that this would cheer her up no end  and as a result of this  I would have a nag-free evening in front of the telly. At this point  I thought I would over indulge with the purchase of some luxury ice cream. I carefully selected the nicest looking clotted  cornish ice cream I could find. I walked almost merrily to the tills  avoiding the self serving robots as I was pleasantly greeted by the human sitting behind the desk. She smiled and I smiled back  as I packed my bag. I thank the lady and proceeded to the car. As I left it was raining moderately  but not enough to dampen my mood.  When I got home  I played my usual childish prank. Which was to pretend that there was no cake left at the shop; bizarrely this seems to amuse me. Telling her that she will have to cherry cough sweets and ice cream for her throat  and nothing else. After a few moments  I showed her the cake. She was shocked to see that i had spent a considerably higher amount more than I usually would do on her. She was very keen for me to dish up the cake.   Now this is the single  most important part of this utterly dull and otherwise pointless story. I opened the polythene packet  and to my disgust the cake was extremely badly packaged. Enough for me to consider my chances of success. The cake was surrounded by cardboard and the bottom of the cake was covered by some sort of paper. Before I was able to plan the best course of the action  the cake was splatted on the floor. The same floor that she had spent mopping only earlier today!   What I did next Tesco  was not my proudest moment. Using the card  you so kindly provided I proceeded to scoop the cake into a bowl. I briefly checked for hairs  but concluded that it should be safe as she had cleaned the aforementioned kitchen tiles this morning. I then piled the ice cream on top  as if to hide any foreign bodies that might lurk on top of the luxury chocolate treat.   When I went into the living room  my partner who was clearly surprised by my lack of food asked  where s yours? . She was even more surprised when I replied that I didn t fancy any  but gladly she was over the moon when I informed her that their was plenty left in the fridge.   So when she went for seconds  and almost slipped in the chocolaty mush that consumed the kitchen floor. Lets just say that I didn t get the blissfully calm and relaxing evening that I had hoped for. In addition to that  the missus still has a sore throat from all the shouting she did.  I write today in relation to the packaging for this product; I feel that it is not satisfactory. In my opinion  opening a box and slicing a sweet treat  should be in theory be no more or less than  a piece of cake .  I look forward to receiving your reply  Matt

Disgusting that you use delivery orders as a way to get rid of out of date stock . I got a weeks worth of food that went out of date today and tomorrow !! I know have no way to get to a shop as I live in middle of nowhere with no shops at all . I don t drive and there is no public transport and registered disabled in a lot of pain  . I have a 1 year old daughter I cannot feed as I ve had to send the food back . The refund for the food and the good will gesture amount to nothing as I cannot make another order without spending ¬£40 to get it ! I am not you dustbin ! How am I meant to feed my daughter ?!! Let alone myself . I even wrote on the notes of my order   no short dates   I should not have to come into store to make sure I get food that is in date . I should not be subjected to your pickers finding the stock that is going out of date and giving it to me so you don t loose money and I do instead . It s hard enough being a disabled mother and looking after myself and my daughter without you making it harder by going out of your way to send out of date food . The dates that where written on the receipt didn t even match the dates on the food . The receipt said the 11-13th yet half went out today and bare in mind I have recieved my order at 8pm the rest went out tomorrow . The bits I ve had to keep to feed my daughter go out of date by the 13th . This was meant to be a weeks shop . On the food I picked it had 4+ days or so on stating these products would last . Yet I receive the stock that should have been binned today or reduced for those who don t mind to pick up . You should not advertise that it has a set amount of days before it goes out on your page and not stick to it . You should not use deliveries as a way to get rid of out of date   short date stock . There are many people like me who depend on this service to have food in there homes as live in remote areas . The closest thing to me is a garage ! They do not even sell food let alone food I could feed my daughter . This is not the first time either ! It is the third !!! The first time I accepted a refund for the out of date product   then for a while things where fine . The second time I was given a refund for the product and then the ¬£40 voucher to make up for the trouble you caused and so I could feed my daughter . Then again after things where fine until again it has been repeated . It was in the news recently how this was being done and it was not acceptable yet you have continued to do so ! I have bought things that where in date date wise yet still off . This is not acceptable

Please pass on a huge thanks and gratitude to the Store Manager and the Team at Tesco Cardigan (Store Number 2215) whilst travelling to visit family yesterday evening through Wales  my petrol warning light came on  not having visited this area before  I searched for the nearest fuel station however at 21:00  the 3 nearest ones to me were all closed. Panicking that my car wouldn t get any further I managed to get to the Tesco in Cardigan (car was now jittering!) but my card did not work for Pay at Pump. I went into the store to find help and Mags Lawson and Olwen Davies behind the Customer Service Desk were excellent. Mags offered to ring her husband for him to take me the rest of the journey and Olwen called the duty manager  Sarah Morgan to see what help they could give as I was stranded. I was able to get cash back in the store and Olwen walked over to the PFS with me and used her own card to fill up my fuel and I gave her the cash. I am a manager with Tesco and it made me proud when I was offered so much help from these very lovely ladies. I hope that all 3 of them can be given a values award for the excellent and professional service which they gave me and also calmed me down. Many thanks!
Just wanted to say a big thank you to driver Dominic  not only did he carry my Nan s shopping in for her today  he also put it away after she came over all shaky and couldn t do it herself.
Just gone to cook my lambs liver I collected from my click & collect yesterday  to discover I ve got kidneys! Not very happy as had to change meals quickly for my twins

I d just like to share my experience with the  new  disabled children s trolly in your Northcott store.   I d like to ask if anyone who works at that store or the ones in charge of trolly maintenance has ever had to push a disabled 5 year old who almost constantly rocks back in forth and flails about in a half working trolly? The straps to buckle him in were frayed and broken! I couldn t even secure him in. The wheels were next to useless as any hope of turning the trolly was near impossible. Parts of the padded seat were torn open. It was a mess pretty much. I had no hope of putting him in a regular trolly as he is too large.  I was so happy to see these trollies become available to Tesco shoppers but sadly today that happiness was ruined as well as the shopping trip.  I appreciate that wear and tear is unavoidable but the state this one trolly is left in is deplorable. It s the ONLY disabled children s trolly in this shop and sadly you have failed anyone who is needing to use it. You have done your part to provide it but clearly the customer service doesn t go beyond that.

Hello Tesco  apologies for reposting this but I think my original post was deleted as it contained an unwanted link. I bought some swimwear from your store in Banchory a few days ago. I took it home to try on as there are no changing rooms in store. Unfortunately  it didn t fit  so I decided to return it  only to be told that I was unable to return it due to  a change in policy . As I understand it  you no longer accept returns on swimwear. I was careful not to remove the hygiene label from inside the swimwear as  on the label  it clearly states that refunds will not be given if removed. This is clearly a contradiction to your new policy as you now won t accept returns full stop. I pointed this out to customer services who politely agreed with me  and further  when I stated that there were no signs informing me of this new policy anywhere in store  they hesitantly agreed. I had to go to great lengths to get a refund (which was reluctantly agreed to) and i m really quite irritated by this. I really love Tesco clothing  but this has really disappointed me. How many people have accepted this new policy  and are left feeling ripped off? I spent ¬£16 on swimwear which I couldn t try on  only to be told there was  nothing they could do  when I asked for a refund. An exchange was also out of the question. I notice that this isn t clearly stated on your website either  but I don t know whether this is due to distance selling or not. Sort it out  Tesco! A disgruntled shopper  Banchory  Scotland.

On 30 th April I ordered a tumble drier from tesco direct.  Last week I was called  to arrange a delivery.  The arranged day was today  Monday 9th May. I was told I would receive a call on Friday with a three hour time slot.  I did receive a call from an automated system on Friday however on answering the phone the time slot was not legible and there was no option to repeat the message. I then called customer services on Saturday to find out the delivery slot   I was told they would contact the courier and call me back.  Noone called back. I called again this morning and was told my delivery slot was 1500-1800 today.  At 1830 I phoned again as my drier had still not arrived. I was told that they didn t know why my drier had not arrived and they couldn t get hold of the courier so there was nothing they Could do except e mail the courier and wait for them to contact me.  So as it stands tesco have ¬£450.00 of my money   I have not received my drier and have no idea where it is our when it will arrive and you have now left it up to the courier despite having taken my money!  I took a day off work today   I can t take another day off so what am I meant to do now? After being letdown by hotpoint with my previous dryer I decided to order through tesco instead as I have always been a loyal customer.  So disappointed that I have wasted a very rare day off work and essentially been fobbed off.

I ve recently had two lovely experiences in the Haydock and Prescot stores. In Haydock as I struggled to the checkout with my very unhappy two month old daughter  a member of staff very helpfully insisted upon unloading  scanning and packing my shopping for me and was incredibly friendly.   In Prescot  after another costumer rudely shouting and hammering on the door of the baby changing room while I was trying to feed my baby (making me have to stop as it made me and my daughter very anxious)  a staff member in the opticians where I had my appointment offered me the examination room to feed my baby in private and made sure we were not interrupted. I bought a raw chicken from your chilled cabinet the other day at Brougham Street/Yorkgate  Belfast. At the selfservice checkout I asked for a single use bag. I didn t enter the bag at the end of the transaction as the law in Northern Ireland states that charges do not apply when purchasing raw meat  prepacked or otherwise  raw fish  hot food takeaway and medicial supplies. As I was leaving the checkout a member of staff pounced on me for now paying for the bag. I explained the excemption to the law but he stated he was not aware of this. He went to another member of staff who also stated she was not aware of this exception. So I stood there while your staff debated a 5p charge. I was made to feel like I was trying to steal a bag and avoid a 5p charge. you need to make your staff aware of the law to prevent them making mistakes that cause your customers embarrassment. It s a shame your staff have so little to do. Should this happen to me again I will take the matter to your CEO.

I have been a fan of tesco all my life  I like the layout  I like the staff  I like the bargains and I also like the fact that no matter where I am in the country if I m on crutches or just not coping being disabled very well that day  I can pop in and get a scooter to help me shop and there is always someone who will help. But I went into clowne tesco on Saturday the 7th may and to my utter shock they have NO scooters and only wheelchairs. If I m on my own that s no good to me. Am I supposed to get one of your staff to push me around with one of those cold metal basket trolley things that clip on. The last time I did this with an inexperienced wheelchair pusher I was in so much pain from being bashed with the trolley thing I swore never again. I was very very disheartened and so the next day I could not have a day of rest I had to go to asda as it s nearer and they had a trolley. Please think of us disabled people who don t want to use a wheelchair and depend on someone to go shopping.

I went to Tesco Opticians last year. Had my eyes tested  and paid a small fortune for 2 pairs of varifocals. I used them for a few weeks. In that time  I wouldnt have recognised my own daughter standing next to me  my vision was so poor. But I persevered with them.Went back to the store and spoke to a different opticion. She retested my eyes  and found the prescription was completely wrong. To your credit  they were replaced. January this year I had a test again. Told I needed stronger glasses  which I got. Been trying to use them  but vision is blurred and I get constant dry eyes and headaches. Now using the old glasses and sight is much better. So I now have new glasses that are unwearable  and cost loads of cash. Needless to say I wont be using Tesco Opticians again.

Thank you Tesco for your colleague waking me up so early. It s lovely being woken up by one of your delivery drivers at 7.15 on a Sunday morning when you re hoping for a lie in on a day of rest. My neighbours normally get their delivery at this time  I am well aware of this fact  but this morning whomever was driving van KY64UVZ  Chatham  Kent needs to be spoken to about early morning etiquette.   I didn t hear anything until a massive bang which startled me  it was followed shortly after by another crash  it turns out he had gotten one tray of goods out and thrown it on his metal trolley and then another out and thrown that on top. He proceeded to do this for all of the delivery throwing the plastic trays around slamming them on the concrete and on top of each other (which needless to say probably didn t do the food much good). This was then shortly followed by him shutting the back door which seemed like he was trying to do it as loudly as he could and him bringing down the sliding door of his van as if he were trying to break it off its hinges. I know it s possible to close it in a quieter manner  after all I never normally get woken by it. After all this was finished everything was slung back in to his van with another massive clatter and the doors shut in the same manner before he drove away. Thanks for being my alarm clock and getting me ready to face the day  after all Every Little Helps!

Hi Tesco. I would like to publicly request that you either a) increase the number of double seated trolleys that you have available or b) require a pound to be inserted to release them in Tesco Bradley Stoke  Bristol.   I have a three year old partially sighted autistic son and a one year old daughter and near enough every time I go to Tesco I have to wait 10-15 mins at customer service while the kind hearted staff trawl the car park looking for a double seated trolley for me. It s either that or carry both my children around the car park myself along with my bags while I look for one myself.   My son is unable to walk around Tesco while I do a full food shop for our family of six and my daughter is too old for the lie back version seat  so it s impossible for me to shop without a double seated trolley.   Customer services tell me because these trolleys are free (they don t require a pound to release them)  people use them frequently when they don t have a pound then leave them in the car park trolley bays. As there is not many of them there are hardly ever any at all in either of the shop front trolley bays. I would happily put a pound in if it meant the trolleys would be available.   I urge other parents with more than one young child from Bradley Stoke and the surrounding areas to back me on this request please! There are loads of trolleys with one seat  and loads of trolleys with a reclined baby seat and a toddler seat but only a handful with double toddler seats.   I note that Tesco in Crawley has also introduced trolleys with child seats for older children with difficulties such as autism. Perhaps you could consider this too?  Please note that I do greatly appreciate the efforts of the staff in Tesco Bradley Stoke as they are always sympathetic and tremendously helpful.   Thank you so much for your time.
Hi Tesco  where has your amazingly convenient frozen avocado gone? Please tell me it ll be available again soon as my son and I have it every day!! Thanks  loyal Tesco customer and avocado fanatic.

I want to pass on MASSIVE THANKS to the staff at Tesco Bangor North Wales.  I m ashamed and mortified to say that I lost my son in store there this evening (around 5:45pm ish)  -  I let him go to the men s toilets whilst I took his little sister the the girls  rightly or wrongly going to the mens is something I let him do whenever he needs to use the toilet - he normally waits for me outside - today for some reason  he didn t. He panicked   thought the store was closing and that he would be trapped inside and left - before I had gotten out of the toilet with his sister. Unknown to me at the time he had found his way back to the car   as he though that was the safest thing to do. I just wanted to give all the staff that helped me a MASSIVE THANKS ! Two ladies in purple t-shirts who were by the toilets saw me frantically shouting for my son in the mens toilets called for help and instantly a mass off staff came from all over the store - some stood by the front door to make sure he wasn t going to wonder out with a stranger - and loads we re looking all over the store. The two guys that stood with me by the front door kept me together with their jolly personalities and reassurance that my boy would be found - if they hadn t have been so smiley and jolly and totally calm i would have had a nervous breakdown - EVERYONE was amazing - I can t believe how fast they all arrived and how quickly they got themselves organised to look for him ... I don t really want to be publicly stating that I lost my son today   but I noticed there are lots of complaints posted and not many post of positivity and praise . My son was fine and as I said he managed to safety find his way back to the car - if I d have alerted staff sooner   he wouldn t have made it out the door. They clearly have a brilliant missing / lost child policy - I didn t get anyones name as I was in a mass of panic but please do pass my thanks on to the store for finding my spider man (he had his costume on) . Thank you !! Lisa :)
Thanks boys and girls.  Cofresh spicy peanuts back on the shelf at Tesco Forest Town  Mansfield :)

Tesco  I am writing to express my disappointment and anger. I moved into The Cube in Birmingham a few weeks ago. My local shop I like to frequent daily is Tesco Express at The Mailbox. Yesterday I went shopping with my boyfriend to get chicken for his dinner. There were several different varieties of chicken.. However  perplexed  we tried to find the Free Range option. We couldn t find the free range chicken but I earnestly asked an employee to direct us to the Free Range chicken. He responded that the store didn t stock free range chicken. I was totally horrified. I want to be able to exercise my right to purchase cruelty-free chicken. Rather than hundreds of people being forced into buying an item that endorses cruelty and gives an incorrect view of people s moral standing.  It is worth mentioning that this particular Tesco is in a highly affluent area and I am confident many of the residents would want to choose cruelty-free for a higher price. We of course didn t buy the chicken. I would like to be able to buy free range chicken from my local Tesco. I would like you to implement this as soon as possible as I believe it is totally unethical. Please do not underestimate my commitment to this cause and the lengths I will go to to get this rectified and allow my fellow residents the option of choosing cruelty free.

I was in my local tesco today doing a bit of shopping when one of my sons fell and hit his head off a trolley. I liked nothing more than one of Tesco`s small fruit cheesecake deserts and now like most things in life they have changed the entire texture. The fruit used to stay on top but now it sinks into what used to be a nice firm cheesecake mix and is now a cross between custard and cream with what used to be a nice crispy biscuit type base that is now wet mush. They really have changed what used to be a special treat into something that takes ages to digest and makes you feel sick to look at.

Tesco ... I thank you. I would like to thank the lady who works the night shift supervising the self checkout tills in your Cardington Road store in Bedford. I ve been having a dreadful time with my property over the last few weeks. I stopped eating evening meals as I cannot eat or drink in my home as the kitchen is not safe to use and the whole house smells of raw sewerage. I didn t eat evening meals for 4 weeks and lost a stone in weight. I started bulling myself into buying sandwich from Tesco very late at night and eating it in my car as I knew if I took it home with me I would throw it away due to the smell of sewerage always lingering.  On the night of April 18th  I arrived at Tesco and wondered around for half an hour trying to convince myself to eat something. It was 23:45 at night and all I had eaten all day was a mouthful of flapjack. Every time I thought about eating I would wretch as I had the smell of sewerage in my mind even though I wasn t at home to physically smell it. After half an hour of pacing the store up and down  I settled unhappily on a chicken Caesar wrap. I did not want to eat it in my car  in the car park  like a sad loner. So I approached the lady who was supervising the self checkouts and I explained the situation at home briefly and asked if I could possibly eat my sandwich in the corner of the closed cafe. She smiled and said   no problem . She made my day! My week and my month!  Since that evening in the Tesco closed cafe eating a sandwich by myself  I have made sure I have continued to eat every evening. I work much later than I should and eat at the office just before I set off home.  I m meant to finish work at 6pm but I ve often remained at work until after 11pm just to avoid going home. I spent over ¬£100K on a building contractor who was supposed to renovate my home. Instead it feels like he has destroyed it and he s left it in a very bad condition.  Tonight I worked unnecessarily late again to avoid going home. I ve just been into the Cardington Road store and the same lady who worked on the 18th April is there again. I ve just approached her as I was buying a sandwich to ask if her manager was on duty as I wanted to pass to let them know how much her kindness a couple of weeks ago meant to me. She said it wasn t necessary as it was nothing.  It wasn t nothing to me. Monday 18th April was the lowest day in my 43yr life. I m such an upbeat  positive thinking  go-getter  that I never would have imagined I could ever feel that low.  I made a promise to myself that night that I would never  ever eat alone at midnight in a closed Tesco cafe again. Life has to be better than that... surely.  I don t know the name of the lady who helped me on the 18th - the lady who thought what she did for me was nothing. To her it was nothing  to me it was everything and I hope you can pass on my thanks and reward her with praise.  Tonight I m eating my Tesco sandwich in my car but I m not in tears this time  I m feeling quite positive as it goes.  My house is still a bomb site and will be for a good while yet. Thank god you have two 24hr Tesco stores in Bedford.  Helen  www.Facebook.com/stinkbombcottage

Could you advise which of the 2 occurrences is correct? Should we have been offered them at the online price?  Many thanks

I am a weekly customer with Tesco  I also have 6 rabbits who I adore!  I know this has been brought to your attention before  so could I implore you to please  please review your selection of rabbit food in your stores. You must be aware by now that sweetcorn kills rabbits. The husks can cause an obstruction in the gut. Unlike cats or dogs  you can t just open up a rabbit s gut to remove an obstruction as the risk of peritonitis is too high. On top of the the aforementioned risk  stasis sets in quickly. Stasis in rabbits results in death within 48 hours.  So why on earth do you still have sweetcorn on your shelves  marketed for rabbits  specifically  when you have been made aware of the risks? If you are unsure  please contact the Rabbit Welfare Association for further information.  I hope you listen to your customers  thanks

To whom it may concern   Today around 5:30pm in Tesco Jervis Street  Dublin I was refused a purchase of champagne  even after providing an entire wallet full of government identification.   Upon being asked to provide proof of age  I happily obliged providing three separate  valid  hologrammed Canadian government pieces of identification. The rude cashier said those were unacceptable and that I am required to show a passport. I asked to speak to her superior  and again was told the same. As I live and work in Dublin  I obviously under no circumstance carry my passport around on a day to day basis.   While I understand this may be an overly cautious company policy to prevent the sale of alcohol to minors  I most certainly do not appreciate being humiliated and angered at till point on a busy Friday evening after work. I m a professional 25 year old woman  who was dressed in office attire trying to purchase a bottle of champagne to celebrate a personal family achievement.   Not only did this ruin my evening after a busy work week  it has also severely dampened the celebratory mood for my husband and I.   Please note that in light of the above events I will permanently cease to frequent Tesco Jervis Street  and will strongly encourage my Dublin City Centre based office to follow suit.   I will note that the young blonde lady supervising was apologetic and polite  however the robust brunette cashier should have further etiquette/customer service training.   I am immensely thankful that there is an M&S just upstairs from your store where I was able to purchase champagne without issue.   I expect a response from a company customer service advisor in a timely manner.   Regards  Tena Doherty

Thank you Two simple words that can t really say what it really means to some . Last night was the first time Tesco ever had the quiet hours for people with Autism and other sensory needs. So I went up to see if it made a difference.It was so much nicer to shop in.I seen some people that I know who have kids with special needs and we smiled at each other and went on our way. On the escalator going down I heard the woman behind me say to her son was it nicer shopping when it was like this.Im not shy so I asked her how it was going and she said it was great. She wouldn t normally bring her young lad shopping . Now that made my day . It made me feel happy that this young lad could go and pick out his Spider-Man outfit without becoming distressed .For his mam to be able to hold his hand and talk about what you was good or what shoes where nice. Shopping for anyone can be a nightmear for kids with special needs it can be really difficult and for their parents and careers it can be a lonely traumatic Expriance.Last night it wasn t. So saying Thank you To all the Tesco staff   Lisa Mcevoy and Damien the MD doesn t really explain how I feel.The words included and valued and matters and belonging all spin to mind. Lisa had the feedback sheets at the customer service desk in Balbriggan .Please please fill them in. Thanks everyone. Hopefully this can happen every week .
Please send me customer head office details to complain

I went in looking to buy a pen used to detect fake banknotes as I was selling my car for cash and didn t want to take any chances and get lumbered with any fake notes. Ashley told me that the store didn t stock these items but once I explained my situation he very kindly offered to lend me one of the store s own pens used at tills so that I could check the money whilst selling my car.  A small gesture I know lending me a pen  but he didn t have to do that and by doing it he helped me out with something non-tesco related which was much appreciated. Needless to say I have returned the pen following the sale of the car! Using it put my mind at ease. He even explained to me what would happen should I come across any fake notes.   Great customer service üëçüèª

Very disappointed with Tesco.  I bought two ¬£25 visa gift cards at Southampton branch for Mothers Day gifts for my mum and mother-in-law. The cashier scanned the cards and charged me for them but when my mum and mother-in-law tried to redeem them they discovered they had not activated  even though I had paid for them. I no longer had my receipt as I was unaware they were not activated and thought they already been spent my mum. I decided to go back to Tesco to have a look at the gift cards and found out there is a strip on the back of the card that has to be removed and scanned to activate. I picked up two more to replace the previous ones and when I went through the checkout the cashier did the same thing again! They scanned the small barcode at the top of the packet  I told them the packet says to remove the panel and use that barcode to activate it. The cashier and supervisor were unaware that if the panel was not removed and the small barcode was scanned then the customer is charged for a card that is not activated!! Very annoyed that I ve now spent ¬£105.90 to get two ¬£25 gift cards. ( 2 x ¬£25 for two unactivated cards and 2 x ¬£27.95 for two activated cards (yes you get charged ¬£2.95 for activating each card!!)) Tesco needs to train their cashiers how to process gift cards properly.

***HAS ANYONE ELSE HAD CONTAMINATED FUEL FROM TESCO SOUTH WIGSTON???*** I have had no end of stress and trouble for the past month with my car after filling up my tank at Tesco South Wigston Filling Station. After various investigations and mounting costs from a few garages a test was carried out on the fuel itself and finally a diagnosis of the fuel is what caused my car to stop running perfectly. I have had the tank drained and the car is now back on the road. However I contacted Tesco today and they are denying that there was any issues with their fuel in South Wigston on the 3rd of April 2016!!!! Interestingly I went to see the duty Manager last night (Milissa) who confirmed they had indeed had several cases of fuel contamination and apologised etc explaining that they did try to contact as many vehicles as possble through number plate recognition but could only reach so many (me not being one of them). I told her that they should have done more to try and solve the problem by putting large notices on the petrol station forecourt and in store saying they had a problem so that customers could come forward! Anyway I also went to speak to Tony in the petrol station counter point and he said he was sorry  that he recalls serving me that day and me going back to ask him if there was an issue with the fuel and he said I was the first customer that came back that day so at that point he did not know there was an issue but that many cars after me came back to and were all referred to Head Office. The famous Head Office have responded by saying they have had no reports at all from South Wigston petrol station! I am appealing for anyone who has any information to message me please - anything at all ... do you know of any fuel contamination at Tesco recently. do you know anyone this has happened to and do you know if Tesco have admitted it? Please help - thank you. I intend to take this to the Small Claims Court so need all the help I can get as my costs incurred to date are over ¬£2000 so I cannot let it go. Thanks  Ana.

I was tired  hot and bothered  what I wanted to do after work today was go home and get spectacularly drunk and eat junk food while Channing Tatum looked after my every whim.   What I actually did after school was pick up my equally hot and bothered children  who outdid themselves by throwing some  stroppy  an irrational  into the mix and drove them to Tesco Express  Silva Island Way  Wickford to use the photo booth so that we may apply for their passports.   At this stage  I need to stress that the booth is INSIDE Tesco. So I queue up  and cheerily asked the cashier if she could change the two ¬£10 notes so that I may use the photo booth (it is still INSIDE Tesco) and was told that they were not allowed to give change for the photo booth (the booth that is INSIDE Tesco). My shoulders drop  dismayed at this I wearily ask what the cheapest thing is that I can buy and proceed to purchase a pack of unwanted gum just for an easy solution. The cashier processes the transaction and hands me my change.....which consist of 8 ¬£2 coins and some small change. Now  I already know that the booth takes either a ¬£5.00 note or a combination of two ¬£2 coins and a ¬£1 coin (using the exact money only)  however the change that the (now smirking) cashier hands me (as she slams the till drawer closed) does not contain any combination of the correct coins or notes. She simply grins and says  Well  you asked for change .  So we repeat the entire exercise with another ¬£10 note and I am now 2 unwanted packets of chewing gum better off with the urge to jump over the counter and shove both packets into the cashiers smug face. Needless to say  I didn t  although she was left in no doubt about my feelings towards her actions.   I am now at home drinking wine  I have avoided the junk food so far  I am fairly certain that Channing Tatum is not coming  but I have my pictures  my health and I was not arrested for assault today....all in all  today was a good day.

I have been a loyal customer of yours for nearly 20 years  and I feel the need to bring to your attention the terrible customer service I received at your Meir store in Stoke On Trent a couple of days ago.   I took a tv/dvd combi in to the store that is faulty and will no longer play dvds. After explaining the situation to a staff member at the customer service desk I was immediately put onto a telephone with barley an explanation   with no acknowledgment of my issue  in fact your member of staff hardly made eye contact with me let alone showed any empathy or sympathy.   The member of staff I then spoke to on the phone proceeded to take 10 minutes asking endless  and mostly irrelevant  questions only to tell me that I would have to contact Toshiba (the manufactor) myself.  After explaining that this was not helpful to me as my contract is with Tesco as the retailer who sold me the item   which was under 12 months old  I requested to speak to a manager in the store from your member of staff I had originally spoken to.   Again  with no explanation she walked to the telephone at the other side of the counter  turned her back to me and spoke in a low voice into the phone  obviously explaining to your manager her version of what had happened.   Your customer service manager came across a few minutes later.  Again I received no sympathy or empathy to my situation  she barely acknowledged it and had clearly pre empted what she was going to say after her discussion on the phone.   I found her rude and unsympathetic to my issue and began a conversation with regards something that had happened to her which was irrelevant  with no apology for my situation or seeming to care. She flatly refused to help remedy the reason that I was in your store and even implied that I should be grateful that I had had 11 months use of the tv.   I left feeling totally humiliated that this was conducted in front of other customers and members of staff who were watching and listening and I do not feel as though I received any kind of customer service at all. Not what I would expect from a large company as yours with such a good reputation.   I told your manager that I would take the matter further which was received with a smirk  and I left feeling totally under valued as a loyal customer of yours.   I will not be shopping at your company any more   and I am totally frustrated at the attitude I received from your staff. Not one of them took ownership  all three of them passed me on with no consideration whatsoever.   I appreciate that you may have policies (although I am certain many other large companies would have refunded me with no question for a tv/dvd worth around ¬£100)  but I was made to feel through your staff s questioning that it was somehow my fault and my problem that it had broken after such a short time.

Another good reason I must remember to not shop at Tesco..... Staff who have worked for the company since before 1999 will have their Sunday premiums cut from double time to time and a half. Some night Workers who are contracted to Saturday and Sunday nights are set to lose thousands of pounds a year. Cutting of night premium 1 will impact on all twilight workers who currently work between 10pm and midnight costing them between ¬£1.50-¬£3 a day. It will also mean a reduction of 79p a night for all night workers. Giving a 3.1% pay rise to some staff  1.6% to night workers and a pay cut to other members of staff is not  fair . Tesco openly admit the cuts to long standing colleagues pay is helping to fund an across the board  pay rise . But for many staff it s a pay cut. The reduction/cutting of location pay is also going to impact many staff  some who work in areas where the cost of living is already extremely high. Offering a one off  transition  payment of 18 months worth of the difference is not good enough. People have made financial commitments based on their take home wages  now they are having them cut they will find themselves in serious financial difficulty. Tesco should not be allowed to take money out of people s every day wages to fund a pay rise for  some  colleagues. If they have to reduce wages then it should be done over a longer period of time  giving colleagues 5 months notice that they will be thousands of pounds a year worse off is quite frankly disgraceful.

I never usually complain about anything but after what happened yesterday  I felt the need to have a wee moan. Yesterday  I wasn t feeling too great so we decided to go to the cafe in the Kilmarnock branch. I needed a sit down and a drink  I was feeling very lightheaded. I ordered a drink and picked up prepackaged pancakes. My partner and kids all had a drink and a cake too. I opened my pancakes and put butter on the first one  took a bite and it was raw on the inside. My partner took them up to the counter to ask if I could swap or get my money back and the lady at the till said that s how they re meant to be and they come to the store that way. So  I m guessing that means I have to take them home and finish cooking them myself?  Anyway  we were refused our money back and I never got any kind of offer of a replacement. If I had been feeling better I might have went to the customer service desk but instead I just went home.

recently switched from shopping at Sainsburys Bell Green to Tesco Elmers End even tho Sainsburys is walking distance from me. Thanks Tesco s shopping is so stress free now.

I am really disappointed with our experience of your company yesterday .I do  not think either individual was  the problem both were nice and helpful  but gave conflicting advice which meant that my son who has ADHD and ASD became extremely distressed  His  Hudl  screen broke ( surprisingly ) I phoned athe helpline - the lady was lovely and reassured me that we could get it quickly sorted out and gave me the timeline she said I could take it into store and  they would contact their service  it would be picked up by Wednesday   and fixed ( if deemed accidental damage for ¬£59.99) But when we took it into Kingston park Newcastle store they told us that this was not a facility that was offered and advised us to by an alternative  - my son became really distressed as he had been reassured that the hudl he loved with all his data on would be fixed with a clear timeline We bought an alternative as recommended but would have preferred  to have had it fixed .My son has been unduly distressed  by this conflicting information and I am aware that the individual staff did their best with the information that they had but I believe this is an issue that your company needs to resolve to avoid dissappointment distress and inconvenience to other  customers .
